name: Boutique hotel in Antwerp · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
host_about: Ever since my childhood I dreamt of having my own small/tiny 'hotel' and my dream became real. In combination with my passion for designing interiors, I'm absolutely doing what I like to do most: hosting & decorating, an ideal match.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.79 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: There is a paid parking lot around the corner. In case you come by train, it takes a thirty minutes walk from the station to the apartment, or you can take the subway from the central station to ''Groenplaats'' (2 mins from the apartment).
host_about:
Hello! My name is Kristien, living and working in the center of Antwerp. I own a little café and always enjoy discovering cities, making nice rides on my motorcycle, and going for long walks with my little dog called Roma. 

Please, do not hesitate to contact me in case you would have any questions or requests. I speak Nederlands, English and français.
Hope to meet you soon and to make sure you'll have the most wonderful stay in Antwerp that you could wish for.

Best greetings from Antwerp!
At your service,
Kristien

name: Rental unit in Antwerp · ★4.81 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: leuke residentiële buurt
host_about:
I'm a reader, gardener and I like meeting people. I also like cooking, going to restaurants, concerts, theatre and dance-performances. I try to be a real ambassador for my city and region.

Being a member of the Antwerp B&B-Association, I rent my groundfloor apartment on a professional basis. If you need an invoice for your stay, that's no problem.

I dislike arrogant people.

name: Rental unit in Antwerp · ★4.87 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
host_about:
I am a 39 old, married woman. My husband's name is Yves. We have a great 12-year old son, his name is Igor. 
Me and Yves both work for the government. 
I am totaly into photography and literature, Yves is totally into Belgian beers ;-)

name: Rental unit in Antwerp · ★4.63 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
we live on the 5th floor on top of a bed store Nico's Slaapcenter.
tramstop DE LIJN = DRINK is at 50 meter
host_about:
We, Lieve (52 y.) Fronk (49 y.) love talking, laughing and music.
Communication is always easy as we speak several languages
Fronk is crazy about Brazil, where he lived for 2 years
Lieve adores India.
We have a preference for natural, vegetarian food.
Lieve and Fronk  practice Yoga daily..
We and our neighbours live on pleasant terms with each other.
Tranquility is a must in our home and in the building.
Please ring our bell... N°116/5L (fifth floor)

FLANDERS TODAY a flemish online newspaper has published an article about us and about Airbnb:
“In the last year we’ve had 60 or so guests staying with us at home,” says Fronk, who, with his partner Lieve, is one of the best-rated Flemish hosts on Airbnb, a hotel-like service for the digital age. “We have had guests from Brazil, the US, Canada, Iran, Japan, Bulgaria and more. Though no one from Africa has yet requested to stay.” 
Airbnb is an online marketplace for temporary accommodation across 33,000 cities in 192 countries. Trip planners can find spare rooms, flats, sofa-beds and even igloos and private islands. Some hosts are simply renting out a spare room for a couple of weeks a month to travellers to supplement their incomes or to fill the house when they themselves are away. 
Airbnb is in the vanguard of the so-called “sharing economy”, in which web services help private individuals monetise their possessions and share anything from school runs to electric drills. Flanders has more than 900 listings on the site. 
Connections 
Fronk and Lieve say that their guests have loved Antwerp and always have a good time. Yet if a number of their guests are visiting for tourism, many are in town for less conventional reasons. One was interviewing for a job at the opera house. Another was doing a course with world-famous contemporary artist Jan Fabre, while a third was studying with a leading dancer. A medievalist stayed for several weeks to learn Dutch for her research, while a Canadian rock band crashed when gigging down the road. 
Connecting with new people with different world views is one of the attractions, as is discovering a unexpected shared interest. “The other day I was having a bowl of soup with one of our guests, who had just arrived from the United States,” recalls Fronk. “To our surprise, we soon discovered that we were both working on essays on the same subject.” Fronk, who is a literary translator of Russian and a performer, and Lieve, an organist and soprano, say that in their year of hosting they have yet to have a bad experience. Some guests stay several weeks, some come back for a second or third visit. “But we make it clear on the website that we are vegetarians, that we do yoga and that this is a family house,” Fronk explains. This attracts people who are into the same things (and probably discourages those who want to spend their time exploring Antwerp’s party scene). 
Peer reviews 
Fronk and Lieve live in Borgerhout, a neighbourhood with a large immigrant population just east of the city’s Central Station, which is visible from their balcony. Borgerhout itself does not house many attractions and enjoys a reputation for being a rough sort of place. But guests have never had any problems, says Fronk. Indeed, he wistfully recalls a middle-aged American visitor looking out of the window at the district where Fronk grew up and declaring it a beautiful place. 
Importantly for guests, the area provides easy access by foot or bike to Antwerp’s main sites, including the zoo; elephants can be heard vaguely trumpeting from the flat’s balcony.

name: Loft in Antwerp · ★4.81 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Excellent location. There are plenty of great restaurants and coffee bars within walking distance. Feel free to ask me for tips

If you have a car you can reach the freeway to Brussels (E19 and A12) in 5 minutes. Street parking is easy to find and is free from 19:00pm till 9:00am, on Sundays and Public Holidays. There is a cheap underground public parking (Indigo Parking Nationale Bank) within 50 meters, open 24/7.

Across the street, you'll find:
- Pharmacy
- Pizza Hut take away
- affordable but good restaurants (e.g. Continu Food & Drinks)
- Bike Share Station
- Public transportation: bus, tram and taxi
- Antwerp City Park

If you would like to get some groceries, there is a Louis Delhaize Supermarket just around the corner.

There is a local organic bakery (the croissants there are AMAZING!) just around the corner if you want to have a delicious breakfast. There are many good restaurants within walking distance.
host_about:
My apartment is often empty and it deserves more attention than I can give, that's why I rent it out.

I love good food, expensive and cheap. Traveling and meeting amazing people. Love a good movie at the movie theater every now and then. Message me if you have questions!

name: Rental unit in Antwerp · ★4.55 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
It is a mixed cultural neighborhood. A lot of young people moved in, providing a new vibe. New restaurants, cafes, shops pop up all the time.
So they call the neighborhood BOHO.
There is a beautiful art deco cinema turned into a cultural centre a bit further. Check the program of 'De Roma' for concerts, films etc.

On the ground floor of the apartment building is a handy small supermarket. Other shops like fresh bakery, butcher, fish are around the corner on the Turnhoutsebaan.

On Friday morning you will find local produce at the vegetable and fruit market at the church of Laar (which you can see from the terrace).

Hop on tram 10 or go for a walk to Zurenborg neighborhood with its famous Cogels-Osylei dotted with dazzling art deco houses.
host_about:
I studied languages and cultural anthropology and am currently teaching Dutch to teenage migrant children in Antwerp. I also play the violoncello.
We travel a lot and spent some years abroad (NZ, USA) before returning to Antwerp.  We know what we missed in our temporary lodgings, that's why we try to make our apartment a home away from home for you.

name: Home in Antwerp · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about: man

name: Loft in Antwerp · ★4.43 · 1 bedroom · 1 bath
host_about:
My two passions are traveling and designing interior and furniture. With airbnb i get to share both, because I believe the design of my appartment is also one of the reasons you choose for it. Since I travel a lot for work and private purposes, my appartment is empty quiet a lot and so i like others to enjoy it too! Also I just love to take good care of people, so whenever you come at my place I will always try to put in this little extra thing to make you smile!

As a lot of people I started renting out my place to have an extra income, to cover for my bills and to create some financial space to travel more myself. Recently I started sharing my profit with charity because I wanted it to be something more, for me. So now 5% of the profit I make renting out my appartment is donated to charity. 'SOS Kinderdorpen' at the moment, I will add more later on.

name: Rental unit in Antwerp · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Nearby you find the busy Diamond District, the cosy Zurenborg Quarter, the historic city center and the trendy Zuid District.

All this you can easily discover by foot, bike or public transport. All is very easy accessible. If you like to bike, you will find also the city bike rental 'Velo' in front of the house.
host_about:
Elizbeth makes tailored clothing and Marc is working for television. Elizabeth is passionate about antiques while Marc is mad about fine wines.
In a previous life Elizabeth lived in Amsterdam, London, Boston and Warsowa. Now she feels completely at ease in fashion city Antwerp.

name: Loft in Antwerp · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Still young and upcoming neighbourhood. Everything is on walking distance:
Grocery store +/- 50 m
Bar +/- 50 m
Restaurant +/- 50 m
Bike station +/- 20 m
Tram +/- 30 m
host_about: I've been a very active couchsurfing host and guest for a few years but lately i would like something more when i'm travelling. That's why I like Airbnb so much. It gives you the chance to be local and not wander in a hotel the whole time.

name: Rental unit in Antwerp · ★4.65 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The area near the river is called ‘t Zuid, just a 10-minute walk to the old city center and well connected to public transport.
In the neighborhood, you can find supermarkets, banks, trendy bars, designer shops, and many restaurants only a few minutes away.
"'T Zuid" is known is hip and unique atmosphere.
host_about: Hi I'm Sarah. I'm a painter and I love Antwerp because its creativity. I love character in people and things. Enjoying experience and beauty in life.

name: Boutique hotel in Antwerp · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
aplace/antwerp is situated in the middle of the old town of Antwerp. On the corner of ‘de Groenplaats’ and the Big Market, the designer shops and the ‘Kloosterstraat’, known for its antique en curiosa. The ideal spot to discover Antwerp!

De Vrijdagmarkt is a quiet square that hasn’t been discovered by the big audience yet and ideal to meet local Antwerp people.

Very unique and traditonal is the weekly auction on - fridays - on the ‘Vrijdagmarkt’. Here you can buy for a cheap price exclusive, retro and sometimes even valuable objects.

On this square you’ll also find the world famous Plantin-Moretus museum. The only printing/publisher in the world from the Renaissances and baroque time which has kept remained.

host_about: Ever since my childhood I dreamt of having my own small/tiny 'hotel' and my dream became real. In combination with my passion for designing interiors, I'm absolutely doing what I like to do most: hosting & decorating, an ideal match.

name: Rental unit in Antwerp · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths

host_about: Ever since my childhood I dreamt of having my own small/tiny 'hotel' and my dream became real. In combination with my passion for designing interiors, I'm absolutely doing what I like to do most: hosting & decorating, an ideal match.

name: Rental unit in Antwerp · ★4.82 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
host_about:
We are a artistic & adventurous couple who likes a good combination of arts, farming, food, drinks, travelling , city life, rooftopgardening, running a restaurant, bar and club, organising markets, making music, creating pottery and many more..

We try to inspire others to create your own world and follow your dream by just start doing iT! We never get bored and we love to meet people. That’s how we end up in hosting 3 adventurous Air BnB appartments. We like to make people feel at home and create some characterfull places with vintage & handmade design.

name: Rental unit in Antwerp · ★4.60 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1 bath
host_about:
I'm 39 years old, study Language and Literature at UA and work part-time in Antwerp.  I love the lively atmosphere of every city and try to enjoy it as much as possible. Going from concerts at festivals or parks, fashion and shopping, theatre performances, museums or just strolling through the city. And since I'm very social and quick to make contacts, the vision of an AirBnB is right up my alley. Providing a cosy space for wanderlust travelers, handing information about my town and creating some interaction without obtrusiveness. So travelling  in an unconventional way and interacting with locals is something the guests and I have in common. After travelling to San Francisco to live with a childhood friend, participating on an intercultural project in Mexico, sharing the apartment of an inhabitant in Berlin, Valladolid, Barcelona, Vienna, etc I even try to make a holiday out of being at home. Or as one of my favorite Dutch writers, Godfriend Bomans,  would put it; "The art of living is to be at home when one is travelling". I hope to bring my guests a feeling of "Home" during their stay and hopefully soon I'll meet and welcome you in Antwerp, I'm looking forward to it.

Ik ben  29 jaar, werk parttime en studeer  taal- en letterkunde aan de Universiteit van Antwerpen. Ik hou erg  van het levendige en bruisende, dat elke stad in zich heeft en probeer daar zoveel mogelijk van te genieten:  de terrasjes, optredens in parken of festivals, shoppen,   theatervoorstellingen, musea, flaneren door de stad, noem maar op.  Vermits ik vrij sociaal ben en snel  contacten maak, past de AirBnB -formule  helemaal in mijn visie: een cosy plek verschaffen aan de reislustige gasten, hen informatie geven over mijn stad en enige interactie opbouwen zonder opdringerigheid. Eén punt hebben de gasten en ik gemeen: we reizen graag, doen dit graag op een niet al te conventionele manier en houden van interactie met de plaatselijke inwoner(s).  Zo ging ik naar San Francisco om bij een jeugdvriendin in te wonen, nam deel aan een intercultureel project in Mexico,  deelde het appartement van een inwoonster in  Berlijn, Valladolid, Barcelona en Wenen, enz.  Ik probeer me ook thuis op reis te voelen of zoals de Nederlandse schrijver Godfried Bomans, één mijn favoriete schrijvers, het stelde : ” De kunst van te leven is thuis te zijn alsof men op reis is ". Ik hoop dat ik mijn gasten een gevoel van 'thuis zijn'  tijdens hun reis kan geven en hoop jullie snel te mogen verwelkomen en ontmoeten in (Website hidden by Airbnb) kijk er alvast naar uit..

Tengo 29 años y estudio Lengua y Literatura en la Universidad de Amberes y trabajo a medio tiempo en la ciudad. Me encanta el ambiente animado de cada ciudad y trato de disfrutarlo lo más posible con paseos a conciertos en festivales o parques, a través de la moda y las compras, obras de teatro, museos o simplemente pasear por la ciudad. Como soy una persona muy social y que rápidamente hace contactos, la visión de Airbnb es lo mío. Ofrezco un espacio agradable para los viajeros con deseo de explorar, facilito información sobre mi ciudad y establezco algún tipo de interacción sin impertinencia. Viajar de una manera poco convencional e interactuar con la gente local, es algo que los clientes y yo tenemos en común. Después de haber viajado a la ciudad de San Francisco para vivir con una amiga de la infancia, participado en un proyecto intercultural en México, compartido el apartamento de un habitante de Berlín, Valladolid, Barcelona, Viena, y más lugar, hasta trato de hacer unas vacaciones estando en mi casa. Como dice uno de mis escritores Neerlandés favoritos, Godfried Bomans "el arte de vivir es estar en casa cuando uno está viajando." Espero darles a mis invitados una sensación de "hogar" durante su estancia y espero que pronto pueda darle la bienvenida en Amberes.

我今年 29歲，在UA修語言及文學，同時在安特衛普打工。我喜歡每一個城市的熱鬧氛圍，不管是音樂節，公園演唱會，時尚購物，戲劇表演，博物館，或在市中心散步，我都盡可能找機會品嘗。另外我很樂於交朋友，不管是提供舒適的空間給旅遊愛好者，傳達關於我的城市的資訊，或無壓力的互動，我很理解也能夠發揮Airbnb想表達的精神，畢竟非凡的旅遊方式和與當地人交集是我們的共同點。
我曾去舊金山與兒時的朋友居住，參與過墨西哥的多重文化案子，與他人居住的城市包含柏林，巴拉多利德，巴塞羅那，維也納，等等。在家時我也儘量保持旅遊的心態。我最愛的荷蘭作家『Godfriend Bomans』曾說:『生活的祕訣在於旅遊時也感受到家。』我希望來這裡的客人都有這樣的感受，並期待很快能歡迎您來安特衛普。 

我今年29岁，在UA修语言及文学，同时在安特卫普打工。我喜欢每一个城市的热闹氛围，不管是音乐节，公园演唱会，时尚购物，戏剧表演，博物馆，或在市中心散步，我都尽可能找机会品尝。另外我很乐于交朋友，不管是提供舒适的空间给旅游爱好者，传达关于我的城市的资讯，或无压力的互动，我很理解也能够发挥Airbnb想表达的精神，毕竟非凡的旅游方式和与当地人交集是我们的共同点。
我曾去旧金山与儿时的朋友居住，参与过墨西哥的多重文化案子，与他人居住的城市包含柏林，巴拉多利德，巴塞罗那，维也纳，等等。在家时我也尽量保持旅游的心态。我最爱的荷兰作家『Godfriend Bomans』曾说:『生活的秘诀在于旅游时也感受到家。 』我希望来这里的客人都有这样的感受，并期待很快能欢迎您来安特卫普。

name: Boat in Antwerp · ★4.75 · 10 bedrooms · 20 beds · 2 shared baths
host_about: Ik vind het leuk om alternatieve projecten op te starten en nieuwe marken te verkennen, daarvoor ben ik over de hele wereld gereisd. Op deze manier kom ik graag in contact met mensen van over de hele wereld. Met ons schip Hannus kunnen we informeel onderdak verlenen aan reizigers die net als ik op zoek zijn naar avontuur en waarvoor luxe geen noodzaak is. Belangstelling voor natuur, cultuur en schoonheid vind ik belangrijk. Het gaat mij om blijvende waarden.

name: Bed and breakfast in Antwerp · ★4.75 · 4 bedrooms · 6 beds · 4.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Artist area-Dageraadplaats.
Close to Central station, shopping area and the major Concerthalls, like Elizabethzaal or Roma and Rataplan.
host_about:
Your hosts

For 20 years we lived and worked in different Asian countries. We where based in Thailand, Malaysia, Sri-Lanka, China and India.
Paul as Manager-Technical Advisor in Diamond Manufacturing Company’s. Patricia as a Documentary-Photographer.
In 2006 we decided to extend our family, we settled in Antwerp and in March 2007 our daughter Vita was born.
Patricia bought the anno1870 old Mansion in 2003 and with the original architecture in mind we renovated the entire house, into a unique and original B&B.
In Januari 2010 Patricia finally opened “Antwerp Bed and Breakfast.” We run our business not as a job but as a passion in life. Our goals are an excellent around the clock service, but most important to make our guests feel comfortable and relaxed like we would do with our own family.
Our hobby’s Art lovers. Vita’s hobby’s are, making mess and
listening to fairytales.
We look forward to welcoming you!
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Rental unit in Antwerp · ★4.91 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Aplace/antwerp is situated in the middle of the old town of Antwerp. On the corner of ‘de Groenplaats’ and the Big Market, the designer shops (the famous Dries van Noten shop is around the corner) and the ‘Kloosterstraat’, known for its antique en curiosa. The ideal spot to discover Antwerp!

THE AUCTION ON FRIDAY
De Vrijdagmarkt is a quiet square that hasn’t been discovered by the big audience yet and ideal to meet local Antwerp people. Very unique and traditonal is the weekly auction on - fridays - on the ‘Vrijdagmarkt’. Here you can buy for a cheap price exclusive, retro and sometimes even valuable objects.

PLANTIN-MORETUS MUSEUM
When staring out of your windows you'll see the beautifully enlightened building of the Museum Plantin-Moretues. The only printing/publisher in the world from the Renaissances and baroque time which has kept remained and the only museum in the world on the UNESCO World Heritage list - so for sure a must see!

DESI
host_about: Ever since my childhood I dreamt of having my own small/tiny 'hotel' and my dream became real. In combination with my passion for designing interiors, I'm absolutely doing what I like to do most: hosting & decorating, an ideal match.

name: Home in Antwerp · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath

In a nice and quiet street .

name: Rental unit in Antwerp · ★4.72 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Te voet ben je in no-time in de gezellige buurt aan het Museum van Schone Kunsten waar het moeilijk kiezen wordt tussen de vele cafés en restaurants. Ook de befaamde modebuurt met het Modemuseum, Dries Van Noten en andere stijlvolle adresjes ligt op 5 minuten wandelen. In de Kloosterstraat kan je dan weer terecht voor antiek en curiosa, ook op zondagnamiddag!
Voor je boodschappen kan je terecht in supermarkt Carrefour net achter de hoek. Erg handig want deze is ook op zondag geopend!

Op de Vlaamse Kaai zijn er - naast de vele designwinkels - ook enkele delicatessenwinkels en bakkerij Dellafaille (top!) waar je zeker iets naar je gading vindt.

name: Townhouse in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Het huis bevindt zich in een zeer rustige doodlopende straat. de buren zijn zeer betrokken en behulpzaam.
host_about:
Hi there
I'm the proud owner of this cosy house. I live here with my son and we love to call this place our home.

We have a beautiful cat Karamel and two chickens. The eggs they make during your stay are yours :-)

When we are on holiday we love to have guests over that can enjoy our home as much as we do.

We live just outside the city center (10m. tram/bus) and our garden is part of the beautiful parc Rivierenhof.

You will love it here!

name: Townhouse in Antwerp · ★4.64 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: I love my neighborhood because it is a very calm and quiet place just 15 munites away from the city center. It is also a multicultural neighborhood with  good vibes, especially in summer you can find everybody outside and children playing
host_about: I myself have travelled a lot in the world with my backpack and that is why I got the idea to rent our second  room because it is always fun to meet other travellers and to help them around in our beautifull city of Antwerp. You can expect a warm a multi-ethnic welcome in a cosy house. Always eager to give good info on our city.

name: Home in Antwerpen · ★4.48 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
The house is 200 meters away from a very cosy place named 'Dageraad plaats', where you can find a lot of nice restaurants and bars. There's a supermarket 50meters from the house. On the corner of the street, there's also a gas station with a small shop.
If you stay for a longer period, you can find a washing salon in the street from the bnb.
host_about:
Hello, my name is Terra. 

Although ‘La Terre Bleue’ has existed for over a decade, I just took over the bed and breakfast with my boyfriend Seba and dad Marc. The founder of the airbnb was my mother, Fatima and since a couple of years I started helping around. She was Brazilian, loved cooking, music, meeting new people and also loved hosting in our cozy and colorful house. In her memory I reopened the Airbnb. We hope you’ll feel welcome and at home. 
 
The house has three floors. On the first floor you have a huge living room and a giant kitchen with a cooking island and all needed utilities. There’s also a little terrace. On the second floor you have the shared large bathroom with a separate shower and a big bathtub. 
The house offers five bedrooms on the second and third floor. Single and double beds are available.

It's not a house with a lot of house rules; but we expect our guest to have awareness of some fundamentals like; respect, hygiene and open communication. 

The location of the house is ten minutes’ walk from Antwerpen Berchem station and Antwerp Central station. From the house it’s a five-minute walk to public transportation. You have also a really nice square in five minutes walking distance "Dageraadsplaats" with a lot of cafes bars and restaurants. There is a supermarket 50 meters from the house, open all days. There is also a very large supermarket about 300 meters from the house.

If you would like to discover Belgium's gastronomy and culture, combined with Brasil's hospitality, don't hesitate to send me a message!

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.49 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Het appartement is gelegen op 150 m van de Grote markt en de Scheldekaaien. Het is een gezellige straat en waar je culinair kunt genieten van verschillende restaurantjes.

Tussen de historische panden en galerieën, is er voor de kinderen een klein speeltuintje dat zich midden in de straat bevindt.

Vanuit het appartement is het ongeveer 10 minuten lopen naar het trendy Zuid met zijn eigenzinnige winkeltjes, vintagezaakjes en hippe uitgaansgelegenheden.

Ook loop je vanuit de Zirkstraat in korte tijd naar de winkelstraten, historische monumenten en vele cafeetjes en terrassen waar je kunt genieten van het Bourgondische Vlaamse stadsleven.
host_about:
Wij zijn Leonie en Ahmed. Wij houden ervan om te reizen en nieuwe sfeervolle adresjes te ontdekken. Zo genieten we ervan om de fijne ervaring die we zelf hebben met het verblijf in ons appartement te delen met anderen die de stad Antwerpen willen verkennen of gewoon een heerlijk weekendje met vrienden door willen brengen.
We vinden het belangrijk om vanuit vertrouwen en respect om te gaan met andermans eigendom, maar ook zorg te dragen voor de wereld om ons heen. 
Sfeer en eigenheid is voor ons onmisbaar.. Dat maakt de plek waar je verblijft..

Daarnaast zijn we graag bezig met het creëren van nieuwe dingen; meubels maken, fotograferen, beeldend werken.

Stad en platteland is voor ons een belangrijke afwisseling, zowel om te wonen als om te reizen.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.33 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Surrounded by many cool bars but always quiet inside. Museum of Fine Arts and the Muhka at 100m distance!

name: Townhouse in Antwerp · ★4.85 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:

'Boho' is een bruisend deel van de stad met een multicultureel en artistiek, bohemien karakter. Overal duiken hippe cafés en restaurants op.
De Elisabethzaal, de Lotto Arena en het Sportpaleis; de grote concertzalen van Antwerpen, zijn vlakbij.
host_about: Interested in interior architecture, decoration and food, I want to create a feeling of coming home for my guests. As I love my city Antwerp I can help them to find special places to eat, drink and visit.

name: Rental unit in Antwerp · ★4.86 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Located in the center of Antwerp (south of city center), the apartment is situated with an abundance of restaurants, bars, shopping, landmarks and galleries. A great location for couples and families visiting Antwerp and seeking a great place to stay.
Due to its proximity to the city center, most places are within walking distance. However, you can also take the tramway or bus – both are 50 meters from the apartment – to help you explore or get around the city:
- Central Station (most beautiful train station in the world!)
- palace on the meir: a genuine palace. The originally 18th century building used to be the home/residence of important rulers such as Napoleon Bonaparte.
- Antwerp Zoo is one of the oldest and best-known zoos in Europe
- Aquatopia is like living under the ocean in the future
- Pirates Island is a great place for children aged between 2 and twelve. Here, you can meet Peg Leg and his mates where you can play for hours in a renovated wa
host_about: Ik heb psychologie en human resources management gestudeerd. Ik werk voor een project in het bedrijfsleven rond diversiteit. Mijn doelstelling is openheid te creëren bij bedrijven voor personen met een arbeidsbeperking, 50 +'ers, allochtonen en jongeren laaggeschoolden. Daarnaast probeer ik in mijn vrije tijd zoveel mogelijk te reizen en speel ik piano en keyboard in een bandje. Sinds enkele weken ben ik gestart met airbnb en ik vind het fantastisch! Leuk om mensen te kunnen ontmoeten over heel de wereld. Ik verwelkom u graag in mijn appartement en geef je al de nodige info over leuke plaatsjes in Antwerpen. Tot binnenkort!

I'm a reader, gardener and I like meeting people. I also like cooking, going to restaurants, concerts, theatre and dance-performances. I try to be a real ambassador for my city and region.

Being a member of the Antwerp B&B-Association, I rent my groundfloor apartment on a professional basis. If you need an invoice for your stay, that's no problem.

I dislike arrogant people.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.71 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The flat is located near the green heart of Antwerp: 3 parks including the open-air museum 'Het Middelheim', conference centre Antwerp Expo and cultural temple 'De Singel', and cosy restaurants within walking distance.

Its practical location near the motorway exits makes it the perfect base for visiting Antwerp, but also Brussels (35 km away).
host_about:
I am Katrin, and live with my husband in Antwerp. 
In our house, we have a completely separate spacious flat.

The flat is located outside the city, close to major parks. By public transport, tram and bus or Velo (bike), you can quickly reach the centre of Antwerp. 

Within walking distance there are some cosy restaurants and enough shops to get your own food. 

Hope you will enjoy it!

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.89 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Vlakbij het bruisende zurenborg zonder dat je hiervan overlast ondervindt. Het centrum van Antwerpen is met de vele vervoersmogelijkheden (tram, bus, velo's, ...) vlot bereikbaar (Kathedraal op 15 minuten te bereiken).

Supermarkten, een bakker en andere winkels kan je vlakbij vinden.

Het grote Berchem treinstation is op slechts 400 meter gelegen, De Antwerpse ring ligt op 100 meter (zonder geluidsoverlast).
host_about:
Ik ben 31 jaar oud. In het verleden heb ik vele seizoenen gedaan als skileraar. Na een geweldige tijd heb ik besloten om me terug in Antwerpen te vestigen. Het is een beslissing waarvan nog geen seconde twijfel heb gehad.  Gezien ik altijd graag mensen een leuk verblijf heb bezorgd in het toerisme wilde ik dit ook in Antwerpen verder zetten door het verhuren van een camper en een appartement.
Sinds ik met mijn vriendin Maartje samen ben en ons appartement af heb gerenoveerd  gaat het absoluut geweldig. Wanneer we samen terug gaan skiën met de nieuwe camper verhuren we soms ook ons eigen huis in Borgerhout.

Wanneer er tijd is geef ik graag zelf gegidste wandelingen door onze mooie stad.

Mijn hobby's zijn fietsen, klimmen, skiën en telemarken.

Contacteer me zeker voor een mogelijke korting. De situatie is verschillend voor elke huurder. Voor ons is een aangename relatie met de huurder erg belangrijk.

host_about: Ik ben 60 jaar en geef les in het schooltje om de hoek.  Mijn 4 kinderen zijn het huis. Sinds ik airbnb heb leren kennen, ga ik veel op reis en had ik steeds prettige airbnb-ervaringen.  Ik kijk er naar uit om nu ook vakantiegangers te kunnen ontvangen.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.85 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The myriad of choices when it comes to bars and restaurants. The availability of authentic ethnic food, still having some of the best Belgian brasseries in the area AND true haute-cuisine for the fanatic foodies.

You can take a stroll along the Schelt, sit in the sun on one of the many different squares which are scattered around this neighbourhood or browse one of the many museums. Take a look at the Museum of Fine Arts, Museum of Contemporary Art or the Fashion Museum, all walking distance!
host_about: I work at a software company that develops innovative software for banks and other key players in the financial services industry. I'm an avid reader, always keen to meet new people and up for new experiences.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.82 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath

The cathedral and city hall are just 50 meters away, and the main shopping street 'Meir' is 300m away.
host_about:

name: Home in Antwerpen · ★4.84 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: We love about our neighborhood that it's very central, there are some nice small restaurants and bars just around the corner, a good bakery for fresh croissants and delicious pies and several sandwich shops. The historic Cathedral of Antwerp is at walking distance, the ZOO just around the corner and in summer the Park Spoor Noord is a very relaxed location to enjoy some drinks and music.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.79 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We have a very lovely lively neighbourhood. There's a lot of couleur locale, Moroccan teahouses, places where you can eat, nightshops. And since a couple of years a younger, hipper crowd, that makes sure there are some nice bars and stuff. More and more galleries are opening here and a couple times a year we have some big art happenings.
We are around the corner of the famous theater and concert hall De Roma and not very far away from musiccentre Trix.
host_about:
We are a artistic & adventurous couple who likes a good combination of arts, farming, food, drinks, travelling , city life, rooftopgardening, running a restaurant, bar and club, organising markets, making music, creating pottery and many more..

We try to inspire others to create your own world and follow your dream by just start doing iT! We never get bored and we love to meet people. That’s how we end up in hosting 3 adventurous Air BnB appartments. We like to make people feel at home and create some characterfull places with vintage & handmade design.

name: Home in Antwerpen · ★4.71 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
By foot:
= Zurenborg: trendy area with pubs, restaurant and nice villa's.
= Zoo: the Zoo of Antwerp is the oldest in Belgium, ideal for children.
= Central station: beautiful building completely transformed inside in 2007.
= Meir: the main shopping street of Antwerp.

By bike:
= Centrum: you'll find everything what you want.
= Rivierenhof: big park ideal to have a picnic, to run or to be in the nature; in the summertimes, everyday, open air concert in a spectacular setting
= Park Spoor Noord: big green area with fountains, skate park, ping pong table and place for barbecue, of course there is also a bar and a playground.
= South Antwerp (Het Zuid): the south of the city is the trendy neighborhood where you find trendy restaurants, cozy bars, literary cafes, art galleries, art shops, interior design shops …
host_about:
"La casa di Frà" was built with the idea to learn to know people who travel around, with different stories and experiences.
I am Frà, short for Francesca, an Italian but I moved to Belgium 10 years ago to be with Dominique, my Flemish husband, with whom I have two little girls. We are an eclectic couple, joined by many small aspects that make our cultural diversity very interesting.
I like to cook, sports and I enjoy my social life. I love the sea and the sun.
I think Antwerp is a funny and interesting city, where you can really find anything what you like on every single moment. 

 “La casa di frà” è nata dal desiderio di conoscere persone che viaggiano alla scoperta di luoghi e di culture diverse. 
Sono Frà, abbreviazione di Francesca, un’italiana che vive in Belgio da 10 anni e sposata con un fiammingo, Dominique, e abbiamo due bambine. Siamo una coppia eclettica,  le nostre diversita' culturali rendono affascinante e interessante la nostra vita. 
Mi piace cucinare, fare sport e chiacchierare con gli amici e conoscerne di nuovi. Amo il mare e il sole.
Trovo Anversa una città divertente e stimolante, tutta da scoprire.

name: Loft in Antwerpen · ★4.79 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Dit is de absolute topbuurt van Antwerpen. Centraler kan je niet vinden. Je stapt buiten en je komt meteen in een gezellige winkelwandelstraat.
Overal zijn er leuke restaurants, lounge-bars, café's en winkeltjes. De Grote Markt met de historische gildehuizen, het stadhuis en het bekende Brabo-standbeeld, iets verder de Kathedraal en als je de straat uitloopt zit je op de oevers van de Schelde waar je 's zomers gezellig kan vertoeven op het ponton.

Als je graag gaat shoppen dan zit je hier op de beste locatie van Antwerpen. Je bevindt je hier namelijk vlak aan de befaamde modebuurt van Antwerpen. De beroemdste designers hebben hier hun ateliers en winkels in de Nationalestraat, Kammenstraat.
In principe is alles op wandelafstand dankzij de formidabele ligging van het appartement.
Uiteraard zijn er ook andere mogelijkheden zoals trams en metro's. Het metrostation vind je onder de Groenplaats en dus slechts op 500m van het appartement.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.69 · 2 bedrooms · 1 bed · 1 bath
Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.37 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
History of the « Eilandje » :

Eilandje started around 1550 and is the oldest port of Antwerp. In the 19th century, Napoleon Bonaparte had the first two docks excavated for an important naval base. This is followed by an intense flowering period in which several other docks will be excavated.
In the 20th century the port activities shift to the North. Most people move away and the « Eilandje » is a deserted area between port and city.

At the end of the 20th century, one can see the potential of the abandoned docks, quays and warehouses. The city writes, together with the organization "City on the River" an international architectural competition and in the early 1990s the Spanish architect Manuel de Solà-Morales draws an initial plan for The Island. In 1997 René Daniel's works out concrete plans for the Old Docks, the Montevideo district and the Cadix district. In 2002 the « Eilandje » gets its own Master Plan.

host_about:
"Adventure is the best way to learn."

Hi everyone,
My name is Christel and this is my story:
I come from the countryside of Belgium. You know...like a small time-stood-still-village where everybody knows everybody :) ? Well, the only way to get out of there once in a while is by going to my favorite city in Belgium, Antwerp.

The City.
I like art, no I mean I LOVE art. Music, theatre, ballet, expositions, literature, performances,...are my sources of inspiration to be creative. I also love  Antwerp is both modern and authentic. It’s a city that moves. There are dozens of cultural activities every week. The food in the restaurants, even in the tiny bars are amazing. It’s ALL about exploring with all your senses. 

About the apartment.
My husband, my kids and I renovated this building a couple of years ago. I prefer to stay there once in a while, having some time for myself. That’s why we decided it to rent it on Airbnb. We’ve chosen for this neighborhood ‘cause it’s the most upcoming place in Antwerp. It’s on a foot walk from the centre and yet it’s different. It’s Antwerps most multicultural neigbourhood. Over 70 different nationalities! And they all have their own cultural traditions which are awesome to discover!

To my guests.
Enjoy your time in Antwerp, they say it's the city of diamonds. 
But for me it's the people who shine :)
Leave a note, a comment or better...a story before you leave. 
I love stories.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.81 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
In the heart of Flanders, Antwerp is a city where history and modernity intertwine, creating a neighborhood rich in culture and contemporary allure. Wander through cobblestone streets lined with medieval architecture, highlighted by the Gothic Cathedral of Our Lady, showcasing Peter Paul Rubens' masterpieces, as well as going though the lively Grote Markt, that with its ornate guild houses, offers a glimpse into the city's vibrant past.

Antwerp's status as a fashion capital is evident in its trendy Fashion District, where chic boutiques and avant-garde designers reflect the city's stylish spirit. The Royal Academy of Fine Arts further adds to this fashionable ambiance. The city's parks and the Scheldt riverbanks provide tranquil green spaces, offering a peaceful escape from urban life.

Meanwhile, the culinary and entertainment scenes in Antwerp are equally vibrant. For food enthusiasts, you can enjoy Belgian chocolates and waffles at cozy cafes, or savor modern Fl

neighborhood_overview:
Surrounding the loft there are multiple restaurants, sandwich bars, bakeries and the most cosy sunny terraces from Antwerp!
Right outside are already amazing Bars and cafees. Jazz bar "de Muze" brings a art deco style back to life and " Het Pelikaantje" is a typical brown cafe were the locals love to hang out for a beer and chat after work. Two breakfast places or right there too.
The big shopping area with “The Meir" is only 3 min from the front door but starts right outside with some vintage, retro shops. The supermarket "Carrefour" is in the basement of the Shopping Center Grand Bazar and is about a minute walk away.
If you love Belgian chocolates, then don't forget to visit Quetzal on the Lijnwaadmarkt. A chocolate bar that brings enjoying chocolate to a whole new level!
host_about: Hi, I'm Petra , a Belgian interior designer.  Me and my daughters lived in Connecticut for 15 years were lots of friends and family came to visit.  Guiding them through world cities like New York and Boston was a joy.  Over the years we traveled often back and forth to Belgium, US but also France.  For 20 years my family and I run a vacation resort in the south of France.  The guest that we welcomed over the years are now all like family and lots of them we have the pleasure of meeting again year after year. Coming to visit and showing my American family Antwerp and surroundings, helps me now to look through tourists glasses.  I love sharing those insiders tips and treasures so please feel free to ask so we can make your trip extraordinary!

neighborhood_overview:
Old 19th century neighborhood, great atmosphere, friendly neighbors, very multi-cultural. One of the more trendy areas of Antwerp: where artists and students live. Lots of culture, restaurants and bars within walking distance.
Visit the Grote Markt (16th c.), Cathedral (gothic), Groenplaats, 't Zuid, FoMu, M HKA (Museum of Contemporary Art), Plantin-Moretus Museum, Rubens House, Rockox Museum, Museum Mayer van den Bergh (Breughel!), Fashion Museum, the MAS, Red Star Line Museum (of emigration), Open Air Sculpture Garden (one of the oldest in Europe), Grand Open Air Market (Saturday/Sunday), Botanic garden, the Zoo (19th c.), the city park, Park Spoor Noord, the art deco pedestrian tunnel (under the river), Henry Conscienceplein (with the baroque Carolus Borromeus Church), the Ruien (late medieval underground sewage system), Bourla Theatre, Schouwburg, Cogels Osy neighborhood (art nouveau streets), and so on. Shopping streets are Meir, Keyserlei, Kammenstraat, Nationale Straat, Hu

name: Home in Antwerpen · ★4.83 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The Coquilhatstraat is a straight street which is part of the original allotment of 1875 of this part of town. The street is situated between the Zwijger- and the Verbondstraat and is seperated by the De Vrièrestraat. Historically the name of the street was Vaderlandstraat but was renamed in 1891 after Aimé Coquilhat (1853-1891) who was vice governor of the former Belgian colony.
The Coquilhatstraat has the typical profile of a street at 'the Zuid', with a construction of late 19th century neoclassical cornices alternated with brick gables and with a monumental building as eyecatcher (source: inventaris onroerenderfgoed).
host_about:
Samen met mijn man en twee kinderen woon ik sinds 2009 in Antwerpen. Daarvoor heb ik in Nederland, Engeland en Duitsland gewoond en gewerkt. Ik hou van reizen en ben ondertussen al op veel plekken geweest. Reizen met een gezin is wel wat anders dan alleen en mede daardoor ben ik op het idee gekomen om een familie-vriendelijke vakantiewoning te gaan verhuren. 

Toen onze kinderen nog een stuk kleiner waren vond ik het lastig om leuke adressen te vinden die voorzien waren van een aantal dingen die je als jonge ouders nodig hebt (en waarvan je geen zin hebt ze altijd mee te zeulen...). 

Ondertussen woon ik lang genoeg in Antwerpen om hier een heleboel leuke plekken te kennen die ik graag deel met gasten. Zowel voor mensen op zakenreis, families met kinderen, stellen of vriendengroepen zijn er veel leuke dingen te doen en te ontdekken. Ik stel mijn stad graag aan je voor!

Het MAS museum is de nieuwe parel in Antwerpen en dit op 500 m van het appartement.  In de buurt zijn te veel goede restaurants om ze allemaal op te noemen, maar NIMMAN ( aziatisch), DE BURGERIJ ( hamburger) en MON (luxe dining) zijn onze favorieten.  Voor een leuk en gezellig avondje op cafe zijn CLODETTE en HESSENHUIS zeker aan te raden.  de vele Antwerpse zomerbars zijn zeker ook een aanrader, zo zijn er in de buurt, CARGO in park spoor noord (minder dan 1 km afstand) en BOCADERO, aan de scheldekaaien ( Max 1 km afstand)

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is in the heart of the Antwerp South Quarter (’t Zuid). An area with many nice restaurants and bars (you’ll be staying just 50 meters from the beautiful Marnix Plaats with great places for food & drinks and the famous Leopold De Waelplaats is just 300 metres from the apartment).

Famous fashion designers, like Ann Demeulemeerster, Dries Van Noten and Walter Van Beirendonck (and many many new and upcoming talents like Anja Schwerbrock) have their stores and ateliers in this quarter. You’ll also find wonderful museums just around the corner; the Royal Museum of Fine Arts (KMSKA), the Museum of Modern Art (MuHKA), the Photography Museum (FoMu) and the Fashion Museum (MoMu) are all just a few minutes walk.

Many trendy Coffee places, even an organic bakery and a gluten free bakery are found at 2 minutes walk from where you’ll stay. A Delhaize supermarket and an organic supermarket are within walking distance as well. The famous Kloosterstraat, a place whe

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.55 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
host_about:
"Adventure is the best way to learn."

Hi everyone,
My name is Christel and this is my story:
I come from the countryside of Belgium. You know...like a small time-stood-still-village where everybody knows everybody :) ? Well, the only way to get out of there once in a while is by going to my favorite city in Belgium, Antwerp.

The City.
I like art, no I mean I LOVE art. Music, theatre, ballet, expositions, literature, performances,...are my sources of inspiration to be creative. I also love  Antwerp is both modern and authentic. It’s a city that moves. There are dozens of cultural activities every week. The food in the restaurants, even in the tiny bars are amazing. It’s ALL about exploring with all your senses. 

About the apartment.
My husband, my kids and I renovated this building a couple of years ago. I prefer to stay there once in a while, having some time for myself. That’s why we decided it to rent it on Airbnb. We’ve chosen for this neighborhood ‘cause it’s the most upcoming place in Antwerp. It’s on a foot walk from the centre and yet it’s different. It’s Antwerps most multicultural neigbourhood. Over 70 different nationalities! And they all have their own cultural traditions which are awesome to discover!

To my guests.
Enjoy your time in Antwerp, they say it's the city of diamonds. 
But for me it's the people who shine :)
Leave a note, a comment or better...a story before you leave. 
I love stories.

name: Loft in Antwerpen · ★4.70 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Borgerhout, or, 'Boho' as we like to call it ;-) is a young vibrant and multicultural neighbourhood. There are plenty of new, alternative and artistic venues. There are nice and cosy bars and restaurants and bakeries just a few steps away. Borgerhout is also an up and coming neigbourhood for young artists with many art galleries popping up.
host_about: We are a family (mother, daughter and son) living in Antwerp. We have a beautiful home that we want to share with people from all over the world.

host_about:
Hi, I'm Karmen, 37 years old and living in Antwerp. 
I love travelling, especially to the Middle East, SE Asia and Africa!
Last year I became a proud mom of a beautiful baby boy, which means my home is completely baby proof now :). 
Besides spending time with him, I like to enjoy good food and company, working in my garden and being active. 
If you'd like to know more about Antwerp or Belgium, I'm always here to help you! 
Enjoy your stay!

name: Home in Antwerpen · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
An oasis of peace in a lively city.

At the end of my street is a beautiful square with some bars and restaurants.

Central Station is 10 minutes walking and city center 15 minutes walking. Most convenient way to move around is by bicycle. You rent subbikes (Velo-Antwerpen) and SWAP-bikes.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.96 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The "Eilandje" district is the oldest port area in Antwerp and is surrounded by water. Today the port activity is more concentrated in the north, but the port feeling still dominates here. Taste the old atmosphere of the unloading quay with monumental warehouses, lanterns, hangars and cobblestones.

For good food, you can undoubtedly find something in one of the many and various eateries in the area. The historic city center is a 20-30 minute walk, where there is an even greater range of food and drink, shopping, entertainment and culture.

The MAS | Museum aan de Stroom, the Red Star Line Museum and the Port House are not to be missed in the immediate vicinity, and underline the connection between the city and the water.
host_about:
I live in Antwerp, and I love being a host here! I like to offer guests a homely & comfortable place to stay, along with a smooth & worry-less Airbnb experience.

I like to travel when I get the chance. When traveling I try to use Airbnb as a guest myself as much as possible, as it's a great way to stay in extraordinary places in the snugness of a home.

neighborhood_overview: The house is located next to the lively en trendy neighborhood Zurenborg where you can find many lovely restaurants and café's. We can help you find some really nice places to go out and enjoy the 'Bon Vivant' living of Antwerp.

name: Loft in Antwerpen · ★4.73 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Where is your accomodation For Rent in Antwerp located?

For Rent Antwerp is located in the ‘Lange Nieuwstraat’ in a nice and safe neighbourhood, University District, in the heart of Antwerp. Parallell to MEIR, main shopping street of Antwerp and at 5 minute walk only from Groenplaats and the old town touristic area. Hardly 10 minutes walk from the main central train and bus station. Shops, supermarket, restaurant, bars, nightlife … all is at a few minutes’ walk around the corner.

Antwerp Centraal Train station – 10 min
Rooseveltplaats Bus station – 10 min
RO & highway access to all Belgium – 10 min
Tram stop at 100m, Metro station at 500m
Brussels Airport +- 1 hour drive
Groenplaats, touristic area and historical city center– 5 min
Student, university and college area – 5 min
Lange Nieuwstraat is only one block away from the ‘Meir’ – thé main shopping street in Antwerp City Centre- if you come for shopping. There is a tram stop
host_about: Hallo, dit huis was ooit een krot, na veel zwoegen is het nu een mooi huis met leuke accommodatie.  Alles er op en er aan en vlakbij het centrum, van hieruit kan je alles makkelijk bereiken en is het super om Antwerpen te verkennen. Ik doe reeds verschillende jaren korte termijn verhuringen en probeer het nu ook eens op AirBNB.  Meer info en leuke dingen te doen of weten over Antwerpen kan je ook vinden op mijn Facebook  Welkom! https://www.facebook.com/ForRentAntwerp

neighborhood_overview:

Ook de befaamde modebuurt met het Modemuseum, Dries Van Noten en andere stijlvolle adresjes ligt op 5 minuten wandelen. In de Kloosterstraat kan je dan weer terecht voor antiek en curiosa, ook op zondagnamiddag!
Voor je boodschappen kan je terecht in supermarkt Carrefour net achter de hoek. Erg handig want deze is ook op zondag geopend!

Op de Vlaamse Kaai zijn er - naast de vele designwinkels - ook enkele delicatessenwinkels en bakkerij Dellafaille (top!) waar je zeker iets naar je gading vindt.

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
De studio ( op de 3 de verdieping!) is gelegen in een mooie, rustige straat. In onze multiculturele buurt kan je lekker gaan eten. Je vindt er trendy, gezellige (h)eerlijke restaurantjes en enkele gezellige cafeetjes. Om de hoek vind je lekkere afhaalpizza of tajine, aan jou de keuze. Naar de wijk Zurenborg met de hippe Dageraadplaats en de prachtige Cogels-Osylei wandel je in 15 min. Ook de Chinese en Joodse wijk en de vogeltjesmarkt kan je te voet bereiken. Het grootwarenhuis “Carrefour express” om de hoek is open tot 20 u. en op zondag tot 13 u. De cultuurtempels "De Roma "(15 min) en "De Koningin Elisabethzaal" : (5 min) stappen.
De prachtige oude stad bereik met de tram of al wandelend. (30 min.) . Wil je winkelen op de Meir of in de Kloosterstraat voor een "must have " interieur, dat kan, te voet is dat 30 minuten stappen of met de tram . (of stads fietsje) Je locatie is TOP!
host_about:
Hello, my name is Maddy. I live in a nice, renovated townhouse in Antwerp and I furnished the roof apartment as a cozy guest house. (since Dec.2021)  I have already had a lot of fantastic experiences with Airbnb as a guest and I would love to give you a warm welcome as well.
I was an art teacher and now I’m retired. I like walking in the countryside, travelling, and exploring beautiful places (around the world). I enjoy art, architecture, nature and meeting new people.  
Please do not hesitate to contact me in case you would have any questions. (by text message, mail, talk by phone or by popping in downstairs during your stay). I hope to meet you soon and  I will make sure you'll have a wonderful stay in Antwerp.  
Best greetings from Antwerp! 
Maddy

name: Home in Antwerpen · ★4.71 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath

I live in a upcomming trendy neighbourhood near Krüger square, a green parc just around the corner of my house. You find bars, restaurants and a biological store around the corner or on walking distance. Public transport to the central station and the city center is very near.

The lovely café "Bar Leon" on The Kruger square has a large and sunny terrace looking over the square and they serve very good wine:-) On sundays they also have an excellent lunch !

name: Townhouse in Antwerpen · ★4.71 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
Het huis ligt in een rustige woonbuurt, tegenover het Groen Kwartier, de site van het voormalig militair hospitaal dat werd gerenoveerd tot een duurzame woonwijk. Sterrenrestaurant The Jane ligt midden in het Groen Kwartier.
PAKT site op wandelafstand met goeie pizzeria , gezellige koffiebar en biercafé.
Veel restaurantjes en terrasjes op 10min stappen op Dageraadplaats

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.55 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath

As a host you can expect the same from me as advice, based on the type of venue you request.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.29 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath

neighborhood_overview: You will be staying in a lively neighborhood in the divercity Antwerp. It is an area with many interesting, often less known things to discover. Around the corner there is cinema Klappei, some cosy café's (de Kroon and de Valk) and the Antwerp Zoo. For shopaholic's, the most famous shopping street of Antwerp, the Meir, is on walking distance about 1.3 kilometers away. At 130 meters you can find a supermarket of Albert Heijn in the Offerandestraat, where it is also fun to shop.
host_about: We like to discover ourselves through our guests. Discover Antwerp from our beautiful apartment! We love to give you local tips if you like that. Hope to see you soon.

name: Loft in Antwerpen · ★4.87 · 1 bedroom · 4 beds · 1.5 baths

neighborhood_overview: In this neighbourhood (Schipperskwartier/University) you find lots of museums, bars and restaurants. The Great Square Market, the Cathedral and the historical city centre are only five minutes by foot. You can also easily visit the trendy Eilandje and MAS with lots of restaurants, bars and nice views. In the evening, when the sun goes down, we really recommand a visit to the riverbanks of 'Schelde'. It's really amazing to see the sun go down. It's a five minutes walk to get to the river banks and the 'Steen' for example, where you have a stunning view.
host_about: Ik ben Kristof en ik woon sinds 2015 in het prachtige Antwerpen waar ik dan ook met volle teugen van het stadsleven kan genieten: uit eten gaan, naar feestjes gaan, musea bezoeken, naar de cinema gaan, in de zomer de parken ontdekken, ... . Verder houd ik enorm veel van reizen en nieuwe plaatsen ontdekken. Ik trek dus ook regelmatig de wijde wereld in met mijn VW bus om leuke plaatsjes te ontdekken, te surfen of te snowboarden.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Een gezellige en rustige buurt en toch vlakbij Antwerpen centrum, wijk Zurenborg of het Zuid.
Vanuit station Antwerpen Berchem (2.5 km) geraak je overal met de trein.
Met de tram ben je snel op de Meir of de Nationalestraat, waar je naar hartenlust kan shoppen.

Tevens een zeer groene buurt met tal van parken op een steenworp van het appartement: Boekenbergpark (100m) heeft een zwemvijver en speeltuin, Boelaerpark (100m) heeft een speeltuin, Rivierenhof (2.5 km) is met zijn 3.2 ha het grootste park van Antwerpen.
Veel musea bereikbaar met tram of bus: M HKA, MAS, Rubenshuis, Red Star Line museum, Diamantmuseum, ...
host_about:

I love family, friends, children, books, healthy food, coffee, music, shiatsu, movies and most of all: travelling. 
I like yoga and it's way of living, like to try new things in the kitchen, mostly vegetarian and world cuisine.

I like to share my apartment with you in an open way. You can use everything here, also the kitchen.

It is centrally located and near a train station, but still has a very distinct and pleasant vibe. The center of Zurenborg is called the dageraadplaats, which is a square with lots of restaurants and bars and a playground for children. Parks and playgrounds are nearby and can be reached on foot easily.
host_about:
Hi, my name is Jasmien. 

Together with my husband, Sam, I live in Belgium's nicest city: Antwerp. We renovated our house for ourselves in 2019, but partly live abroad. We'd love to share our house, which we love so much, with guests. 

Do not hesitate to let us know if you have any questions!

Deze buurt vormt een combinatie van barokke bezienswaardigheden, charmante straatjes en pittoreske pleintjes. Tussen de historische gebouwen, de gezellige restaurants, cafés, terrasjes, winkels en musea is het gezellig wandelen.

Surely it is safe to walk there but if you are very fast feeling unsafe maybe opt for a more expensive location.

It is also a busy environment/neighborhood. My street is quiet as it is a small street. But close to the studio, there is a bigger road which can be crowded. But you are in the centre of course. So people who don't like crowd may feel a bit overwhelmed!

Het Centraal Station en de Zoo liggen vlakbij, maar ook de Elisabethzaal, Vlaamse Opera en volksschouwburg “De Roma” liggen op wandelafstand.

name: Boutique hotel in Antwerpen · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath

neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is an eclectic neighbourhood with shops, green area's, highways and public transport closeby (10min tram to Antwerp Central)

PUBLIC TRANSPORT: The easiest way to get here is to take the train to Antwerp Central station. From there on you can take a metro at koningin ASTRIDplein, it's the square in front of the central station. You can take numbers 2,3 or 6, in the direction of Merksem. It will take you 12minutes - 5 stops, the stop where you get of is 'GASTHUISHOEVE', it's very easy, it's the stop after sportpaleis, it's the first stop in open air. arriving at gasthuishoeve, you are standing in my street, it's just a 250m walk down the street. I always use google maps, button public transport to calculate my route. If you have any difficulty finding your way, please whatsapp me, and I will guide you here!

name: Home in Antwerpen · ★4.96 · 3 bedrooms · 7 beds · 3.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The holiday home for 10 people is located in the historic center of Antwerp

You stay in Leeuwenstraat, a quiet street in the Fashion District, a few steps from:

- VRIJDAGMARKT (FRIDAY MARKET)
A piece of Provence in Antwerp with nice cafés, terraces and with the UNESCO World Heritage Museum of Plantin-Moretus. On Friday morning, the square changes into an outdoor auction of old items and furniture.

- GROENPLAATS
One of the most famous squares of Antwerp with a cozy atmosphere, cafés and restaurants dominated by the beautiful Cathedral of our Lady

- GROTE MARKT
with the impressive building of the Town Hall and the statue of Brabo is overlooking the scenery.

- KLOOSTERSTRAAT
Well known street for antiques, brocante, vintage and interior design shops. De Kloosterstraat is also worth visiting on Sunday when all the shops are open.

- FASHION DISTRICT
With many renowned designers of the Antwerp 6, the

name: Townhouse in Antwerpen · ★4.75 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Welcome in "2060" (the postal code of this area)! A great, lively neighbourhood close to the central station (10 min walk) and the city center (15 min walk). Also, if you plan on attending an event at Sportpaleis or Lotto Arena, this is just a 20 min walk or a 10 min tram ride away. In the neighbourhood itself, you'll find a lot of shops and restaurants, with tastes from all over the world. As Antwerp has about 164 nationalities living in the city (more than New York!!) this is where you can find them. Exotic restaurants side by side with traditional Belgian pubs and Eastern European supermarkets. Looking for something? Sure you can find it here!

name: Serviced apartment in Antwerpen · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
Loft in Antwerpen · ★4.96 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
—
‘Op Den Spieghel' is located in the very heart of historical Antwerp, next to the ‘Scheldt’, our river. Our loft is the ideal base camp for any kind of expedition, job, or adventure: Museums, art galleries, churches, cafés, coffee bars, restaurants, a great amount of authentic shops, and even an art-house cinema are all in the immediate neighbourhood.

—
Besides all these wealthy surroundings, our aerie is located in just a couple of steps away from a fantastic bakery store, some great butcher shops, an ultra-fresh fish seller, various vegan & vegetarian snack-bars and some ultra-polite mini-markets for last-moment-groceries. —Btw. Supermarkets, restaurants, take-aways and some of the best cafés in town are just one step further… all still within a 5 minutes walking distance.

—
Tip: Check ‘Susha’s Guidebook’ for an extended overview of our recommended restaurants, cafés, etc. (the results of 30 years very dedicated ‘research’…). They’re all within
host_about:
Traveling around the world as ’sales representative' for Antwerp fashion designers, or as ‘buyer’ for interior designers, made me be quite demanding regarding the places I was staying. Finding a comfortable, elegant and very tidy stay at a perfect location has always been my main goal.

When traveling for pleasure, I noticed I actually looked for the same kind of qualitative, stylish and —for sure!- authentic spots… Pleasure & business always seemed tightly connected :-)))

Starting from my own travel experiences and the encounter with so many people with various cultural backgrounds made me of course very skilled for the hosting of guests from all over the world. For business travelers, but for sure as well for my beloved friends. So, if you are looking for a kind of specific spot that provides you an ease of living in the heart of Antwerp, don’t hesitate and contact me!

CU soon?!

host_about: Hi, my name is Alexandra and I am a 29-year old with a passion for cooking and travelling (surprise!). I love to explore new countries and cultures. During my travels I’ve met a lot of interesting people, and what better way to feel a little like I’m abroad by becoming an Airbnb host!

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is a lively, hip area, with lots of restaurants, cafe's bars, and of course the MAS museum, and a little further, the Red Starline Museum. There is a large and a small supermarket within 2-3 minutes of a walk from to the apartment.
host_about: I live in Antwerp since 2001 and became a real local in the meantime. I love this city and enjoy living in the close proximity to all kinds of nice cafe's, restaurants, theathers, summer bars, stores, etc! In my free time, I like cooking, reading, watching films, spending time with friends, exploring new spots in and outside Antwerp. For sure you can count on me to get good advice on where to eat or go to, from fine dining to the most child-friendly places. I live almost next door to the apartment, together with my husband and two young children. After working for 15 years in a multinational company, mainly as Customer Service Manager, I have decided in 2017 to have some time off to spend with my family and follow my passions, and possibly make an own business out of it in the future. This also gave me the extra time to be able rent this apartment to guests, so that they can enjoy the space and this wonderful city. The apartment was originally meant for our family and friends visiting us from abroad, but we thought it will be a pity not to share it with others when it is not occupied. Hope you will like and cherish it as much as we do.  And hope to meet you soon!

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.38 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
host_about:
Ik ben 31 jaar oud. In het verleden heb ik vele seizoenen gedaan als skileraar. Na een geweldige tijd heb ik besloten om me terug in Antwerpen te vestigen. Het is een beslissing waarvan nog geen seconde twijfel heb gehad.  Gezien ik altijd graag mensen een leuk verblijf heb bezorgd in het toerisme wilde ik dit ook in Antwerpen verder zetten door het verhuren van een camper en een appartement.
Sinds ik met mijn vriendin Maartje samen ben en ons appartement af heb gerenoveerd  gaat het absoluut geweldig. Wanneer we samen terug gaan skiën met de nieuwe camper verhuren we soms ook ons eigen huis in Borgerhout.

Wanneer er tijd is geef ik graag zelf gegidste wandelingen door onze mooie stad.

Mijn hobby's zijn fietsen, klimmen, skiën en telemarken.

Contacteer me zeker voor een mogelijke korting. De situatie is verschillend voor elke huurder. Voor ons is een aangename relatie met de huurder erg belangrijk.

name: Rental unit in Antwerp · ★4.99 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the “Groen Kwartier", a residential park centered around the repurposed buildings of Antwerp’s former Military Hospital, which date all the way back to 1899. With mostly private homes, generous green spaces and little to no motorised traffic, it is the perfect to place to unwind and escape the hustle and bustle of the city, all while keeping its conveniences right on your doorstep.

Several supermarkets, cafes and delis are just a stone’s throw away, and the neighboring boroughs of Zurenborg and Haringrode are teeming with restaurants to suit all tastes.

Nearby places of interest:
- The Jane, 2 Michelin star restaurant with a long waiting list. But in the evenings you can also try their 'drinks & bites' in the upper room bar.
- De Koninck brewery, take the tour and try the beers (discount available for guests)
- Blacksmoke, barbecue restaurant next to the brewery.
- PAKT - what was once a factory now home to various
host_about:
I'm a freelance webdeveloper living in Antwerp. When I'm not behind a computer I enjoy running and cycling. At least once a year you'll find me in the Alps enjoying the snow.

As a host I hope to provide all the positive things I've experienced travelling with airbnb.

name: Guest suite in Antwerpen · ★4.87 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Zurenborg is a picturesque and lively neighbourhood. It is a unique and protected area in Antwerp, which is famous for its Art Nouveau, Neo-Gothic and Neo-Renaissance architecture. It is full of little bars and restaurants, and is at only 10 minutes on foot from the train station Antwerpen-Berchem. The car-free square "Dageraadplaats" and the square "Draakplaats" are the animated centers of the neighbourhood, lined with bars and restaurants that are always full of local people who sip a drink while keeping an eye on their children playing in the square's playground.
host_about:

"Life.. It is a trip to the unknown, to enjoy to the full extent."

"La vita... Un Viaggio che ti porto verso l'inaspettato, da vivere pienamente."

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.61 · 1 bedroom · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

name: Loft in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Het Antwerpse Zuid kenmerkt zich door zijn art-deco stijl. Hier zijn tal van restaurants en café's aanwezig. In deze wijk ga je de kleinere en unieke boetieks vinden i.p.v. de grote winkelketens.
Een supermarkt is vlakbij en ook het openbaar vervoer (tram/bus) stopt in de straat.
Enkele zéér populaire musea (Museum van Schone Kunsten, Fotomuseum, Modemuseum) liggen vlakbij.
De Volkstraat is dan weer gekend voor zijn unieke horeca zaken, winkels (check Steen en Been) en zijn breedte van de straat waardoor dit een prachtig zicht geeft op het nieuwe Vlinderpaleis (Justitiepaleis).
host_about:
Beste,
Ik ben Charlotte, uitbaatster van koffiebar Charlie's die ook gelegen is in dezelfde straat als de Bed and Breakfast.
Onze loft die te huur staat is gericht op kwaliteit, hygiëne, toplocatie, verwennerij en mogelijkheid tot een origineel en luxe ontbijt.
De prijsklasse ligt dan ook hoger dan een gewone kamer maar de unieke ervaring die je hierbij ervaart in deze prachtige loft proberen we dan ook te accentueren.
Ons team staat ook steeds ter uwe beschikking tijdens de openingsuren om jullie zo goed mogelijk te ontvangen. Bij late ontvangst kan u steeds binnen met een codeslot.

Lieve groetjes,
Charlotte

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is very diverse and lively, you can do everything by foot. You can find coffee, vinyl, local shops on a stone's throw.
You can start a wonderful stroll from the new Port House (designed by Zaha Hadid) via the Red Star Line museum, through the Marina in the direction of the MAS museum and the Port Pavilion. Enjoy the wide range of terraces and eateries in this neighbourhood before continuing your walk to the centre city. You can choose if you continue your walk next to the water and visit 'Het Steen' or through the little streets of Antwerp to enjoy the beautiful facade of the Town hall, the Brabo statue to go the cathedral and to get lost in the shopping streets in the Groenplaats neighbourhood.
host_about:
Being a fan of airbnb myself while travelling, it was a small step to rent a space in my own apartment. This is a nice opportunity to provide a personal touch when staying over in this beautiful city.  Always happy to give you additional information (regarding restaurants, culture,...)  to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. Looking forward to meet you. 
Kindest regards, Tinka

It never grows old and there is so much going on in walking distance. The main shopping street the “Meir” as well as the Antwerp Zoo are just a block away. neighborhood_overview: The house is in front of a beautiful park with a pond that continues into the larger green zone of the Sorghvlietpark and fort 8, ideal for walking, jogging or cycling. The river Scheldt with ferry boats and the nature park De Hobokense polder is about 1.5 kilometers away. You can take tram 4 to the historic centre or tram 2 to the Central Station, or use the system of city bikes. name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Hotel in Antwerpen · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Maison Emile is situated in a quiet, yet central place in the bustling city of Antwerp, the largest city of Flanders. A true metropolis, with one of the biggest harbors in the world, but everything is on a human scale. Architecture, fashion, culture, shopping, all go hand in hand. A visit to Antwerp is something you will never forget, especially when you combine it with a visit in Maison Emile.

There is a tramway, right in front of our door. In just a few minutes it will bring you to all of Antwerp’s landmarks: The central station (declared the most romantic city in the world), the Zoo or our famous shopping street the Meir.

name: Home in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: If this isn’t convincing enough, the location of the house centainly is! Located in one of the most beautiful neighbourhoods in Antwerp: Zurenborg. With it’s bello époque grandeur it proudly shows surprised visitors art nouveau façades, elegant streets and lively squares. The highlight is the 19th century Cogels-Osylei: sublime architecture from around the turn of the previous century. The real beating heart of Zurenborg, the Dageraadplaats, lies next around the cornor of Antwerpsdesignhouse. With trees, a star sky and trendy restaurants, this somewhat alternative place is defenitely worthwile visiting!

It’s right over the restaurant ‘WOK van Antwerpen’. The house is green with a big wooden statue. Next to it you can find the Atlas building from the city Antwerp.

It’s a 3 minute walk to get there and you’re automatically in the centre of Antwerp. Beginning with the zoo. Going to the shopping area will take another 5 minutes to walk.

Grocery store and bakery are next door! Restaurants are nearby depending on what you’d like to eat.

name: Home in Antwerpen · ★4.86 · 4 bedrooms · 14 beds · 5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The holiday home for 14 people is located in the historic center of Antwerp

You stay in Lange Riddersstraat, a quiet street in the Fashion & Sint Andries District, a few steps from:

- KLOOSTERSTRAAT
Well known street for antiques, brocante, vintage and interior design shops. De Kloosterstraat is also worth visiting on Sunday when all the shops are open.

- VRIJDAGMARKT (FRIDAY MARKET)
A piece of Provence in Antwerp with nice cafés, terraces and with the UNESCO World Heritage Museum of Plantin-Moretus. On Friday morning, the square changes into an outdoor auction of old items and furniture.

- GROENPLAATS
One of the most famous squares of Antwerp with a cozy atmosphere, cafés and restaurants dominated by the beautiful Cathedral of our Lady

- GROTE MARKT
with the impressive building of the Town Hall and the statue of Brabo is overlooking the scenery.

- FASHION DISTRICT
With many renowned designers
host_about:
Proud mother of 3 daughters, living with my family in Antwerp.

My mantra : 
"It's a beatiful thing when a career and a passion come together"

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.69 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The condo is located in one of the most beautiful suburbs of Antwerp, close to the major parks of the city.

It is close to 'Den Brandt Park', 'Nightingale Park' and 'Middelheim Park', the latter with art monuments (free entrance). These parks are among the most beautiful of Flanders and definitely the most beautiful of Antwerp. In Den Brandt Park (in the former coach house of the castle) you have the amazing restaurant Danieli il Divino, in a gorgeous setting with great staff and a fantastic menu, it's simply never disappointing!

Across the street you'll find a Carrefour Express. Within 100m you can find a pharmacy, a grocer, a fishmonger, a fromagerie, a pizzeria, a winery, a chip shop, and a Chinese Restaurant. Across the street one also finds a nice Italian restaurant (La Tavola Italiana).

Wilrijk is also home to the largest Jain Temple (outside of India) constructed entirely from beautiful white marble.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.71 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
In the heart of Flanders, Antwerp is a city where history and modernity intertwine, creating a neighborhood rich in culture and contemporary allure. Wander through cobblestone streets lined with medieval architecture, highlighted by the Gothic Cathedral of Our Lady, showcasing Peter Paul Rubens' masterpieces, as well as going though the lively Grote Markt, that with its ornate guild houses, offers a glimpse into the city's vibrant past.

Antwerp's status as a fashion capital is evident in its trendy Fashion District, where chic boutiques and avant-garde designers reflect the city's stylish spirit. The Royal Academy of Fine Arts further adds to this fashionable ambiance. The city's parks and the Scheldt riverbanks provide tranquil green spaces, offering a peaceful escape from urban life.

Meanwhile, the culinary and entertainment scenes in Antwerp are equally vibrant. For food enthusiasts, you can enjoy Belgian chocolates and waffles at cozy cafes, or savor modern Fl
host_about:
Hello, my name is Arne and I’m 26 years old. Love to travel, meet new people and see new places. I enjoy life and try to make the best of it.
If you planned a trip to Antwerp, let me know and I could arrange you a great stay in beautiful apartments. 

Greetings 
Arne
