name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.59 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Amongst locals, our neighbourhood is called ‘Seefhoek’, which is known as a vibrant, multicultural place in town, right next to the old city center. In our colourful streets you can not only buy fresh fruit, vegetables and fish, you can also discover some real gems like an art deco bathhouse and an old theatre. During a 5 minute walk to the central station you come across ‘Winkelhaak’ design centre, ‘Permeke’, our beautiful antwerp library and Antwerp’s own China town, which is hardly more than 1 street :)
Discover our finest beers at ‘Beer lover’s bar’, get into some real old skool belgian folklore at restaurant 'Den Beer' where you can enjoy delicious lobster at very fair prices, or enjoy a freshly brewed coffee at 'Viggo's', all just around the corner!
host_about: Hi! We are Thomas & Jande, we are a couple living and working in antwerp. We love our city and especially our beautiful home, we are looking forward to sharing it with you!

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.46 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
• The apartment is located in a safe, calm & green neighbourhood.
• The city centre is easy & quick to reach by public transport or by bike.

Within short walking distance you can find:
• 2 beautiful parks (with great running routes + some organised sports facilities for groups),
• an open-air ecological swimming pool (for free!),
• cafés and excellent restaurants (please ask us for recommendations),
• a supermarket,
• a pharmacy,
• a bio shop,
• a children's playground,
• a VELO bike station,
• a public transport stop.
host_about:
Hi! 

I am an art and nature lover with a passion for traveling and experiencing new cultures. Extremely lucky and happy to have a job that allows me to combine business and pleasure. 

Love hosting travellers from around the world in my apartment in Antwerp, Belgium. 

I look forward to meeting you and wishing you a great trip!

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.68 · Studio · 2 beds · 1 bath
Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.77 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
In the heart of Flanders, Antwerp is a city where history and modernity intertwine, creating a neighborhood rich in culture and contemporary allure. Wander through cobblestone streets lined with medieval architecture, highlighted by the Gothic Cathedral of Our Lady, showcasing Peter Paul Rubens' masterpieces, as well as going though the lively Grote Markt, that with its ornate guild houses, offers a glimpse into the city's vibrant past.

Antwerp's status as a fashion capital is evident in its trendy Fashion District, where chic boutiques and avant-garde designers reflect the city's stylish spirit. The Royal Academy of Fine Arts further adds to this fashionable ambiance. The city's parks and the Scheldt riverbanks provide tranquil green spaces, offering a peaceful escape from urban life.

Meanwhile, the culinary and entertainment scenes in Antwerp are equally vibrant. For food enthusiasts, you can enjoy Belgian chocolates and waffles at cozy cafes, or savor modern Fl
host_about:
Hello, my name is Arne and I’m 26 years old. Love to travel, meet new people and see new places. I enjoy life and try to make the best of it.
If you planned a trip to Antwerp, let me know and I could arrange you a great stay in beautiful apartments. 

Greetings 
Arne

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.99 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the old town right in the heart of the city.
Historical buildings, such as the cathedral, town hall and others are one block away. You are surrounded by cosy bars and restaurants.
If you are interested in shopping, all the main shopping streets are on a 5 min walk.
The 'Meir' (biggest, most famous street), 'Nationale straat' and 'wilde zee' (high end) , 'kloosterstraat' (antique).
host_about:
Hi there I'm Tobias. 
I'm born and raised in Antwerp and I hope to be able to welcome you here. 
What I really love about the city is that it has everything you need but its still cosy and small so you can do everything by foot or bike. 
I'm born to a dutch father and brazilian mom and like to learn new languages and learn new cultures. I'm fluent in English, Dutch and Portuguese  and can speak a bit of french, spanish and german. Its nice that I can practice these languages some more while hosting! 
One of my Biggest passions is music and I'm lucky to be able to work with it. 

See you soon!

host_about: Our hotel is situated within walking distance of all public transport. There are tram/metro/bus stops close to the hotel (50m), and Antwerp central station is just a 10-minute walk. The city center with shopping streets and Antwerp’s famous sights are easy to reach as well. We’re located in the neighborhood ‘Zurenborg’, a small district with nice restaurants and bars, known for his beautiful Belle-Epoque architecture.

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.88 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
You have picked the perfect location!

You are in the middle of the historic city, cosy restaurants and local pubs. Stroll to the river Schelde or just wander around and discover the city. You will receive our own tips to non-touristic places. During the weekend you can eat amazingly cheap at the 'Volgelmarkt' or drink a glass cava with the locals.
host_about:
Mocht je zin hebben in een goeie kop koffie (of een lokaal biertje), dan ben je van harte welkom in onze koffie bar ROAST Antwerp. We zitten in het historisch centrum (Leeuwenstraat 6), vlakbij de Vrijdagmarkt.
Onze openingstijden zijn van donderdag tot en met zaterdag van 11 - 17 uur en op koopzondagen van 12 - 17 uur. We zouden het leuk vinden om je daar te ontmoeten!

Groeten,

Linda
BnB Antwerp

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.70 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: De Vogeltjesmarkt is de afgelopen decennia getransformeerd tot een toeristische markt. Iedere zondag komen er duizenden voornamelijk Nederlandse en Belgische bezoekers naar de Antwerpse Theaterbuurt om tussen de honderden stand te wandelen. In veel gevallen komt men vooral om te sfeer te proeven. Serieus inkopen doen is niet altijd aan de orde. Het toeristische karakter is vooral duidelijk zichtbaar in het veranderde aanbod. Vogelen, pluimvee en knaagdieren koop je alleen nog maar in het hart van de Graanmarkt. Voor de rest zijn het vooral algemeen handelswaren, kleding, lekkernijen en accessoires wat je in de stands ziet. Naast nieuwe producten vind je ook kraampjes met antiek, brocante en tweedehands spullen op de Vogeltjesmarkt. Daarnaast is Opvallend is het toenemend aantal Nederlandse marktkooplui dat op de Vogeltjesmarkt staat.
host_about:
Welcome to SLEEP INN Antwerp!

We are here to offer tourists/locals/expats all-inclusive apartments on the best locations in Antwerp to explore or work in the city.

Whether you're in Antwerp alone, as an expat, as a couple for a citytrip or a family our accomodations have all the necessary you would need during your stay for both long and shortterm rentals.

All of our apartments are recently renovated and decorated with passion and style. We are located on a few central toplocations of the beautifull city Antwerpen with some of the best views. We also have a cooperation with the best gyms in Antwerp. When you make a reservation with us, you can train for free and use the wellness facilities, group sessions etc. (ask for more information)

 If you are coming to Theaterplein by car you can hire a parking spot for your car safely at our private garage closeby the apartments.

www Sleepinnantwerp be

Kom je dus met de auto raden we u aan om bij ons een parking te reserveren (vlakbij het appartement).

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.87 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to our rustic petit apartment in the historic city center of beautiful Antwerp.

The location is in Antwerp's student area, perfect in the middle between the "Grote markt" and the "Meir" - highstreet shopping.

It's a very quite street, but surroundend with nice little restaurants and bars and great shops.
Just around the corner of the Hendrik Conscience square with its beautifull buildings from the 17th century, a must visit!

From the apartment you can easily walk to the shopping, nightlife or theater district or to the docks ("kaaien").

Just a perfect spot to enjoy the beautifull city of Antwerp!
host_about:
Hi, I'm Paul. 
Born in 1975, married to Maud and  with a young daughter. We are original Dutch, but we live in Belgium for 10-15 years now.  I'm working as a contracts manager for Stork (a Fluor company) and my wife works in the hospitality business in Antwerp. 
We live in the Belgium countryside close to the Dutch border, but used to live downtown and hence we kept our love for Antwerp. 
In 2019 we got the opportunity to buy a beautiful little property in one of the best area's in Antwerp, which we would like to share with you. In our apartment we brought the rustic atmosphere of our home to the beautiful city of Antwerp. 
Very pleased to meet you!

Je bent op wandelafstand van alle toeristische attracties
De Grote Markt met het mooie stadhuis is net om de hoek, alsook shops, restaurants, musea, etc. Het Historisch Centrum is de wijk met veel bekende gebouwen en toeristische trekpleisters als de Grote Markt met het stadhuis, de kathedraal en de Groenplaats. Deze buurt vormt een combinatie van barokke bezienswaardigheden, charmante straatjes en pittoreske pleintjes. Tussen de historische gebouwen, de gezellige restaurants, cafés, terrasjes, winkels en musea is het gezellig wandelen.

host_about:
I like to travel and to meet other travelers. 
All over the world I've been treated with respect and I have met people with warm hearths. I cherish those sweet memories.
Nederland, la France, England, Deutschland, Groot Hertogdom Luxemburg, España, Hongarije, Bulgarije, Litouwen, Marokko, Tunesië, Egypte, Mali, Senegal, Zuid-Afrika, Japan, China, Indië, Thailand, Cambodia, Laos, Mexico, Guatemala, Nicaragua, Panama, Argentinië, Peru, Ecuador, Galàpagos, België.
Welcome to the city of Antwerp.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.22 · 3 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
A charming and modern designed apartment, situated in the heart of the historical centre of Antwerp, accessible with public transport. It is completely renovated in 2016. The 120m2 apartment includes a large living room, 3 bedrooms (with King-sized beds in separated bedrooms), a kitchen, a modern bathroom and 。1 separate toilets.

The neighborhood has a lot of great cafés, culinair restaurants and bars and is just beside Antwerp's largest shopping mall. Everything is within walking distance from the apartment. You can find a lot of touristic sites.

A nice and comfortabel apartment for you, your family and friends to enjoy an amazing time in Antwerp.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
I live near the central station of Antwerp. When you enter the metro you can take tram 10 towards 'Schoonselhof'. You get off the stop after 'Kasteelplein'.
You can also take tram 8 towards 'Zuid' and also here take the stop after 'Kasteelplein' off. If you take this tram you only have to cross the street and you are already at the apartment. Watch the traffic;).
If you like to walk, you should count 25 minutes :).
There is a lot to discover and where I live is just outside the center but with public transport and even by foot everything is easily accessible :).
Restaurants and bars can be reached within walking distance.
Every Sunday there is a market on the theater square. We call it 'Vogeltjesmarkt'.

name: Loft in Antwerpen · ★4.84 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The loft is situated in the very nice neighbourhood of Borgerhout and Zurenborg.
At the Borgerhout side there is a vibrant multi-cultural atmosphere.
At the Zurenborg side there is beautiful architecture and a lot of restaurants around Dageraadplaats.
The hip and cultural South ('Zuid') of Antwerp is at short biking distance , as well as the green area of 'Park Spoor Noord' and the maritime area 'Eilandje' in the North of Antwerp.
Lots to do here!

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Dageraadplaats is situated in the Zurenborg neighbourhood. It's a vibrant but cosy neighbourhood in Antwerp with lots of cafes and restaurants. It's near the old city center and the train station. From here you can visit the whole city easily! Zurenborg is a place with many young peoples so there is always something to do. During the summer there are many concerts and flea markets on the square. There is also a playground for kids and a basketball field.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is situated in one of the nicest neighborhoods, only 10 minutes walk to "de Singel" if you want to pick a jazz concert, dance or theater show. There are 3 beautiful parks around the apartment, and beer brewery " De Koninck" is only 5 minutes walk. There are a few nice coffee bars in the streets around if you want to have a good breakfast to start the day. Also there is a bike stations right next to the building (Red Velo's) where you can pick a bike to get around. City center, shopping area's, museums and lots of unique landmark are only 15 min by bike, 30 min walk or 20 min by tram. Lots of nice (wine) bars and restaurants are so close, you can walk every where if you love to discover this beautiful city.
host_about: I love traveling, books, wine, good coffee, and getting to know people!

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.93 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: TOP LOCATION! The apartment is settled in Antwerpen-Zuid, the vibrant part of the city. Across the street there are many of the most well known local restaurants in Antwerp and of course the famous Museum of fine arts, "Museum voor Schone Kunsten", a building you cannot miss! You find also the museum of modern art, "Mukha", and the photo museum in a few minutes walk. When the sun is shining we definitely recommend "Marnix plaats", the city square that catches all the sunlight with many nice cafe's and restaurants. The shopping streets (Meir, Nationale straat, Schuttershofstraat, etc.) are all at walking distance from the apartment. (Supermarket and bank are at 1 min walking distance.)

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.40 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: In the apartment you will find a folder with all kinds of tips about the neighborhood! The apartment is 10 minutes walk from the central station and the zoo. You then walk along the Offerandestraat, which is a car-free shopping street, where you will also find the supermarket Albert Heyn. You can also shop in the Chinese street for typical Asian specialties, or in the regular supermarket there, which is located in an old market hall! In the other direction you walk further to Borgerhout, with the Turnhoutsebaan as axis along which you will find all kinds of parks, squares and eating and drinking places. Or you can walk further towards the Seefhoek, where you will find, among other things, beautiful Park Spoor Noord. Borgerhout and the Seefhoek are both authentic and lively neighborhoods of Antwerp.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.07 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

name: Serviced apartment in Antwerpen · ★4.68 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We can assure you that this is just the best neighborhood of Antwerp. Super central, a quiet street, close to public transfer, in the middle of the best shopping streets and within 10 minutes walking distance from the best restaurants, cafés and museums. The district is called Sint-Andries and it is located in the southern part of the city centre. The district is bordered by the "Historical Center" in the north, the "Theaterbuurt" in the east and "Het Zuid" in the south. Nowadays, it is the fashion centre of the city and a lot of famous Belgian designers are located here. Vintage, design, interior, fashion and boutiques are key words for what to find in this area.

name: Townhouse in Antwerpen · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.69 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Antwerp is compact and divided into South, Center, and North, all within a radius of 1 to 3 km from the apartment. The tram to Centrum and North stops in front of the door and goes over the Meir (shopping!) stop at the door of the MAS.
apartment is situated on the main axes to Antwerp.
The neighbour next to this apartment is on the left a bio bakery (= de vloere pistolee) and on the right a Chinese restaurant. There is a supermarket at 100m. The City Park is at 600m, hospital Saint Vincent is behind the apartment, a Christian church is at 50m. Basic Fit at 100m.
This apartment is a 20 minute walk or 6 minute tram ride from the center of Antwerp. The Cathedral is at 2 km, the Meir and the Rubens House at 1.5 km, Het Steen at 2.3 km. Palace of Fine Arts or MUKHA 1.2 km. Central station 1.3 km.

neighborhood_overview: This is one of the most popular neighborhoods of Antwerp, not only because it's almost the heart of the centre, but also because on the big square you will find the famous "Vogelenmarkt" every Saturday and Sunday! This location is also a max ten minute walk from all the high lights of Antwerp, no public transfer needed.

name: Townhouse in Antwerpen · ★4.54 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Coffeebar "Black&Yellow" next door serves the best coffee in town.
Gelateria "Germaine" next door serves the best gelato in town.
Bakery "Toon De Clerck" has amazing pastries.
Butcher "Van Puyvelde" makes the best filet américain préparé.
Bagelshop "The Shack" down the street serves really good bagels.
Restaurant "Le Steak" down the street serves really good meat.
Restaurant "L'Officina" around the corner is the best Italian of our hood.
Bar "Brut" is a perfect spot to sip some wine with a bite and enjoy the sunset.
Lots of summer pop-up bars around the waterfronts make the most memorable summer night.

neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.
host_about: Hi, my name is Ella! I help people rent out their apartments in our beautiful city! :)

Serviced apartment in Antwerpen · ★4.55 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: This is one of the most popular neighborhoods of Antwerp, not only because it's almost the heart of the centre, but also because on the big square you will find the famous "Vogelenmarkt" every Saturday and Sunday! This is a big market where you can find the best food, the weirdest antiques, different types of birds and other small animals and the most beautiful flowers and plants. This location is also a max ten minute walk from all the high lights of Antwerp, no public transfer needed.
host_about:
Hi Hello! Ik ben Liselore, 32 jaar en uw host tijdens uw verblijf in Antwerpen! Met liefde voor interieur, architectuur en hospitality begon ik 4 jaar geleden mijn kleurrijke en gezellige bedrijf SHWAY in Antwerpen. Bij SHWAY voelt het alsof u logeert bij uw beste vriend, maar met de service van een hotel!
Met unieke verblijven op toplocaties in het centrum van Antwerpen, uitgebreide tips en weetjes over de stad en evenementen, soepele automatische check-ins, 24/7 bereikbaarheid en een zeer hoge standaard van de schoonmaak, zorg ik voor een gestroomlijnde en onvergetelijke city/business trip in mijn geweldige stad!

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.79 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
You have picked the perfect location!
You are in the middle of the historic city, cosy restaurants and local pubs. Stroll to the river Schelde or just wander around and discover the city. You will receive our own tips to non-touristic places. During the weekend you can eat amazingly cheap at the 'Volgelmarkt' or drink a glass cava with the locals.
host_about:
Mocht je zin hebben in een goeie kop koffie (of een lokaal biertje), dan ben je van harte welkom in onze koffie bar ROAST Antwerp. We zitten in het historisch centrum (Leeuwenstraat 6), vlakbij de Vrijdagmarkt.
Onze openingstijden zijn van donderdag tot en met zaterdag van 11 - 17 uur en op koopzondagen van 12 - 17 uur. We zouden het leuk vinden om je daar te ontmoeten!

Groeten,

Linda
BnB Antwerp

neighborhood_overview:

name: Loft in Antwerpen · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Must do’s:

MAS Museum: The MAS is more than an interesting building with countless impressive objects. Discover what makes the museum so unique and how it works.

MEIR: Meir is the main shopping street in Antwerp, Belgium. It is the most important shopping area in the country

The Cathedral: After 169 years of construction the cathedral of Antwerp finally dominated Antwerp's skyline in 1521 with a height of 123 metres. It's the highest Gothic building in the Low Countries.

We designed a unique city guide together with local @tonyamas. We gathered all our favorite places in the city so you can have the Antwerp experience like a real local.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.80 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The appartment is situated in a quiet but lively area. It's surrounded by 3 nice parks: Boelaerpark, Boekenbergpark and Rivierenhof. On the other side, it's only 1 km away from the famous Dageraadplaats and Draakplaats (Zurenborg) where you can enjoy nice food and typical Belgian beer in one of the uncountable cosy (coffee)bars and restaurants. Even closer (just around the corner), you'll definitely enjoy a drink at Bar Brul or a nice breakfast, coffee or lunch at Café Josee.
If you want to explore the center of Antwerp, it's just 4 km away and very easy to get there by tram, bus, bicycle or even by foot.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the historical citycenter of Antwerp. It's a five minute walk from MAS, het Eilandje, Grote Markt, Groenplaats, Meir, etc..., a 15 minute walk from Central Station and a 1 minute walk from the Scheldekaaien. The neighborhood is surrounded by cosy coffee places, restaurants, shops etc. There's a supermarket in the street.
Charlotte is happy to provide a list with her favorite places in Antwerp. Don't hesitate to ask for it. :)
host_about:
Hi! My name is Charlotte, and I'm thrilled to share my passion for interior design, hospitality, and my hometown of Antwerp with you.

As your host, I'll be available to help you throughout your stay and answer any questions you may have. I'm a proud local of Antwerp, and I'm always happy to share my favorite places to eat, drink, and explore the city.

If you love the interior design of my airbnb's, everything is for sale! Simply let me know if you're interested in purchasing any of the items.

I can't wait to host you in Antwerp and share all that this wonderful city has to offer.

neighborhood_overview:
Concertzalen zijn dichtbij: De Roma & Trix (5 minuten wandelen), Sportpaleis & Lotto Arena (20 minuten wandelen).

Borgerhout is een bruisend district:

- Krügerplein (400 m), Moorkensplein (1,2 km) Dageraadplaats (2 km)
- Rivierenhof (1 km), Park Spoor Noord (2 km)
- De Centers (850 m)

- Café's (Bar Leon, Plaza Real, Mombasa, Bar Bakeliet)
- Restaurants (Glou Glou, Bar Luca, Essen, Briquet, Druiventros
- Snack (Frituur Tina)
- Ontbijt (Hook), IJs (Borgo Gelato)

In het stadscentrum geraak je op 20 minuten met het openbaar vervoer.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.72 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
't Kiel is an upcoming and multicultural neighbourhood in Antwerp. Our street is a small dead-end alley, so there's nearly no traffic. The neighbours in our alley are very kind and friendly.
All kinds of shops are just around the corner, and there's a big park where you can go picknicking.
From the appartment, it's only 7 minutes by bike or tram to Antwerp Zuid, which is the most interesting quarter of the city center, with lots of restaurants, bars, museums etc.
We'll provide a detailed map with our personal tips for places to go.
host_about:
Hey,
Wij zijn Charlotte en Dieter. Wij hebben het gelijkvloers van ons huis hier in Antwerpen omgetoverd tot een gezellig appartementje, en vinden het heel fijn om gasten te mogen ontvangen. We verwelkomen je graag, zowel in ons appartement als in onze mooie stad :)
Hopelijk tot snel!

2060 is an area with many nationalities. So there are a lot of different foodstores.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.43 · 1 bedroom · 6 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.62 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The old city centre is steeped in history. You will find it in ancient building-fronts on narrow streets or in the imposing Grand-Place. The Plantin-Moretus Museum is the only museum in the world to be classified as a Unesco World Heritage site. In the shadow of the Cathedral of Our Lady, the city teems with life in intimate pubs and restaurants. The banks of the Scheldt are a great place for a breath of fresh air.

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
My place is located in a dead-end street with a green square in the middle. It is very quiet, but still close to the city center.
It is very easy reachable by car and public transport. There are also shared bikes nearby.
You can easily jog/walk to a big parc 2km away.
There is also a entertainment center closeby (2km) with a big movie theater, bars and restaurants.
The sportpaleis is a concert hall at about 3km where there are often interesting concerts.
It's also very close to the Port of Antwerp, but still close enough to the center to enjoy Antwerp as a local. Also, it's easy to reach The Netherlands from here.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Our apartement is just a step away from "Het Eilandje", or so called “The Little Island,”
A few years ago, the city of Antwerp started a successful re-development of the old harbor district known as the legendary Schipperskwartier”
Today this neighborhood is a cozy place with a rich history and a limited well-kept and traffic-free tolerance zone for the oldest profession.
The city of Antwerp won the prize for the broad yet precise way in which it approached the red light district in recent years, both socially and spatially.
In the past decade, the harbor area has gone from scruffy maritime wasteland to foodie haven and museum central. Ask any local what prompted the change, and they’ll most likely point you to the MAS, a remarkable sandstone-colored construction. Today, the district boasts waterfront cafés, lofts and another successful museum, The Red Star Line, dedicated to the eponymous Antwerp cruiser company and the millions of emigrants it carried oversea

host_about: Onze B&B Antwerp For Two boek je vanaf 1 nacht in de week en 2 nachten in het weekend. name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.81 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Our airbnb is located in the city center next to the historic neighbourhood and close to the Mas museum and Schelde river bank. The Eilandje, one of the nicest quarters in Antwerp, with his restaurants, harbour and museums is a 3 min walk, the iconic Havenhuis is 15 min further down the riverbank. From the apartment you can walk straight to our lovely Cathedral, in between the Groenplaats en Grote markt. This is the heart of Antwerp. In this area you will find all the bars and restaurants, the diamond museum, the historic buildings surrounding the Grote markt. If you walk further to the south the fashion district awaits you. 5 min to the north of the apartment, you can stroll along the river banks of the Schelde. There are 2 supermarkets within 300m and a laundromat at 50m of the appartment. Long stays may use our washing machine free of charge.
A cheap parking for you car is locate within a 10 min walk.

neighborhood_overview:
We zijn gelegen op het fantastische Theaterplein, op loopafstand van de winkelstraat Meir, Centraal station en het oude Antwerpen. Kom je dus met de auto raden we u aan om bij ons een parking te reserveren (vlakbij het appartement).


Benieuwd naar leuke hotspots om lekker te eten en te drinken in Antwerpen? Ik heb hier een aantal plekjes op een rij gezet. Allen op loopafstand :

- Me & my monkey (koffie en gebak)

- Pasta Hippo Vino (Italiaans restaurant)

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.30 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: The Zuid ("South") in Antwerp is a currently fashionable area of Antwerp. Revived in the mid-1980s, it has an attractive street plan and a few Art Nouveau buildings, such as the former Volkshuis (or Maison du Peuple) on the Volkstraat, but which now houses the Rudolf Steiner school. Three museums, numerous commercial art galleries, fashionable cafes and restaurants, two arts' centres and a sprinkling of up-market shops add to the attractions of the area.

Ellen

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview: Modern apartment on the first floor of a 3 story house, just outside Antwerp. Recently renovated, everything is new and shiny. Vivid neighborhood close to shops, restaurants and parks. Art-deco neighborhood 'Zurenborg' in walking distance.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.33 · 1 bedroom · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

neighborhood_overview:
Het Zuid is a neighborhood known for it's stately mansions, wide streets and beautiful squares.
Art lovers can find many galleries and museums here, such as Sofie Van de Velde, Tim Van Laere, M HKA, FOMY and many more.
This part of town is also known for it's many popular bars and restaurants such as Hopper, Pilar, Glass, Ferrier 30 etc.

neighborhood_overview: The studio is at 1,5 km from the old centre Antwerp, 1,5 km from the central station, and 1km from the 'south', Thé place to be, with a lot of nice bars, restaurants, museums. Also for shopping, all the boutiques are nearby. You can do everything on foot or on bike (antwerp rental bikes nearby).
host_about: Ik reis veel voor mijn werk, al 25jaar, als stewardess voor een Belgische luchtvaartmaatschappij en weet wat het is om je ergens thuis te voelen. Hier thuis bij mij kan ik u een heerlijke plek bieden in een comfortabele, luxueuze, rustige en lichte studio gelegen in het centrum van het  bruisend Antwerpen. Vlakbij het centrum en toch een stille oase waar het heerlijk rustig is om te slapen. Ik zorg ervoor dat alles perfect verloopt.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.75 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths

name: Loft in Antwerpen · ★4.96 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: BOHO (Borgerhout), is het kleurrijkste en levendigste district van de Antwerpse binnenstad. 'Op de Turnhoutsebaan vind je heel de wereld'. Maar ook in de wijkstraten zijn  er verschillende cafés met terrassen, koffiehuizen en restaurants , ook kunstgalerijen, winkels van alle slag (gaande van biowinkel, ambachtelijk ijs, frituur, supermarkt, nachtwinkels). Een buurtpark vind je op 100m van de studio.
host_about: I am a retired teacher who is now working as a tour guide in Antwerp.  I can give you all tourist information about our city and surroundings. We opened our airbnb loft in March 2020 and we hope to receive many visitors.

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Het appartement ligt tegenover het mooiste park van Antwerpen. Het Rivierenhof. Hier kan men zeer mooie en rustige wandelingen maken. Dit op de grens van Borgerhout en Deurne. Op wandelafstand zijn verschillende eetgelegenheden, supermarkten. Het Sportpaleis, Lotto-arena, Trix en vele andere trekpleisters liggen op wandelafstand. Er kan gratis geparkeerd worden op de parking en op straat. Doch is deze vooral s avonds volzet en is de privé parking aangewezen.
host_about: Ik ben Steven, 40 jaar en afkomstig uit Lommel. Sinds 2019 woon ik in Borgerhout. Ik werk voor de Vlaamse overheid in Antwerpen.  Andere mensen gelukkig maken, maakt mij gelukkig.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.62 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The location is superb; a quiet neighbourhood with 3 big supermarkets and smaller groceries within 5 min walk and fast access to both city centre and train station.
The studio is situated in a quiet side street with everything you need in a short, walkable distance. There is a bakery, butchery, cheese shop, several big supermarkets and pharmacy on Herentalsebaan (main street) all within 1-5 minutes walk.

You can reach several parks within 10 minutes walk. Boelaerpark & Boekenbergpark border to several organic/hipster coffeeshops. Rivierenhof is the biggest park with a huge lake where you can make nice walks and picnics.
There is a swimming pool within 20 minutes walk from the house.
host_about: I am a dancer-performer. I like to cook and travel. I love greens, open air, water, meeting different people and discovering small treasures on my way.

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This area has everything: charm, old architecture, great shops and places to grab a bite. Here are a few places nearby:

• Me and my Monkey •Great coffee, smoothies and cake

• Titulus - Marvelous wine bar

• Dansing Chocola - Cozy at night with heated seats outside

• Fez - Marocain restaurant

• Wasbar - Coffee and ironing :)

• Fiskebar - Best fish in town

• Charlie’s - Most Instagramable breakfast & brunch

• Divers - Healthy good smoothies & sandwiches / salads

• ‘T Hoofke - Such a romantic walk to find it, cute small ’hidden’ restaurant
host_about: Moved from Amsterdam to beautiful Antwerp. Working in film and therefore traveling for work a lot.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: The neighbours in the building are very very nice! They are willing to help you with everything you need. Just make sure they will still like future guest too and respect their sleep ;-)
host_about:
Hi there

My name is Thomas and I'm born and raised in Antwerp. I like cooking, cycling and skiing. I've recently rebuild this apartment and now I finally live here. 
Besides that, there is no secret place in Antwerp if we talk about restaurants, nice bars and fun spots to go out. I even have a list of restaurants per category which I'm happy to share with you when you stay in Antwerp
For work, I travel a lot to Amsterdam, Berlin and Copenhagen so always up for a drink there. 
That is also the reason why my apartment is on AirBnb

Hope to see you soon

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.76 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Smack in the middle of Antwerp center located at the Meir. The biggest shopping street in Antwerp. The apartment is two doors down from "het stads paleis" the former residence of Napoleon Bonaparte and the home of famous painter Peter Paul Rubens House is just around the corner in 5 minutes walking distance. The Stadsschouwburg of Antwerp and the Antwerp Opera house is within 10 minutes walking distance. Amazing Michellin star restaurants and affordable restaurants are all in walking distance. If you would like to explore the city by bike there are shared "Velo" bikes parked in front of the building.

name: Loft in Antwerpen · ★4.95 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Cross the river
As Europe’s second biggest port, the river Scheldt is Antwerp’s lifeblood.
The Left Bank is an exceptional part of Antwerp. A major asset of Linkeroever is the open and green character. Summer pop-ups and epic city views.

De Molen is a big open air swimming pool on the left side of the river (Left Bank). It might not be the first place to come to mind when you want to go for a swim but it has a lot of charm and there is a lot to do: take a stroll on St. Anneke Beach, have a picnic and enjoy the most beautiful views you'll find in Antwerp.

Antwerp is full of surprises. Take its city beach, Saint Anneke, on the left bank, for example, where you can come for a walk, a nice meal or just to chillax.

Saint Anna Beach on the left bank refers to the former village of Saint Anna, when the beach was a popular attraction with many of the locals. They would typically come here by ferry to enjoy the famous mussels of Saint Anneke.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 shared baths
host_about:
We, Lieve (52 y.) Fronk (49 y.) love talking, laughing and music.
Communication is always easy as we speak several languages
Fronk is crazy about Brazil, where he lived for 2 years
Lieve adores India.
We have a preference for natural, vegetarian food.
Lieve and Fronk  practice Yoga daily..
We and our neighbours live on pleasant terms with each other.
Tranquility is a must in our home and in the building.
Please ring our bell... N°116/5L (fifth floor)

FLANDERS TODAY a flemish online newspaper has published an article about us and about Airbnb:
“In the last year we’ve had 60 or so guests staying with us at home,” says Fronk, who, with his partner Lieve, is one of the best-rated Flemish hosts on Airbnb, a hotel-like service for the digital age. “We have had guests from Brazil, the US, Canada, Iran, Japan, Bulgaria and more. Though no one from Africa has yet requested to stay.” 
Airbnb is an online marketplace for temporary accommodation across 33,000 cities in 192 countries. Trip planners can find spare rooms, flats, sofa-beds and even igloos and private islands. Some hosts are simply renting out a spare room for a couple of weeks a month to travellers to supplement their incomes or to fill the house when they themselves are away. 
Airbnb is in the vanguard of the so-called “sharing economy”, in which web services help private individuals monetise their possessions and share anything from school runs to electric drills. Flanders has more than 900 listings on the site. 
Connections 
Fronk and Lieve say that their guests have loved Antwerp and always have a good time. Yet if a number of their guests are visiting for tourism, many are in town for less conventional reasons. One was interviewing for a job at the opera house. Another was doing a course with world-famous contemporary artist Jan Fabre, while a third was studying with a leading dancer. A medievalist stayed for several weeks to learn Dutch for her research, while a Canadian rock band crashed when gigging down the road. 
Connecting with new people with different world views is one of the attractions, as is discovering a unexpected shared interest. “The other day I was having a bowl of soup with one of our guests, who had just arrived from the United States,” recalls Fronk. “To our surprise, we soon discovered that we were both working on essays on the same subject.” Fronk, who is a literary translator of Russian and a performer, and Lieve, an organist and soprano, say that in their year of hosting they have yet to have a bad experience. Some guests stay several weeks, some come back for a second or third visit. “But we make it clear on the website that we are vegetarians, that we do yoga and that this is a family house,” Fronk explains. This attracts people who are into the same things (and probably discourages those who want to spend their time exploring Antwerp’s party scene). 
Peer reviews 
Fronk and Lieve live in Borgerhout, a neighbourhood with a large immigrant population just east of the city’s Central Station, which is visible from their balcony. Borgerhout itself does not house many attractions and enjoys a reputation for being a rough sort of place. But guests have never had any problems, says Fronk. Indeed, he wistfully recalls a middle-aged American visitor looking out of the window at the district where Fronk grew up and declaring it a beautiful place. 
Importantly for guests, the area provides easy access by foot or bike to Antwerp’s main sites, including the zoo; elephants can be heard vaguely trumpeting from the flat’s balcony.

name: Loft in Antwerpen · ★4.90 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The loft lays close to the trendy neighborhood "Het Eilandje".
Het Eilandje – ‘The Little Island’ – is so-called for good reason: Antwerp’s oldest port area is surrounded by water. Today, port activity is more concentrated in the north, but the feeling of a port is still very much present. Savour the historical atmosphere of the old loading dock with its monumental warehouses, lanterns, hangars and cobblestones. Three major attractions, MAS | Museum aan de Stroom, the Red Star Line Museum and the Port House, have once again drawn attention to the links between the city and the water.

name: Townhouse in Antwerpen · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Onze woning is de ideale uitvalsbasis als u Antwerpen wil beleven in alle facetten die de stad rijk is:

WATER: Op 300m van onze deur kunt u gaan uitwaaien of joggen op de kaaien langs de rivier Schelde. De jachthaven en boottochten zijn eveneens op wandelafstand

CULTUUR: Bij ons slaapt u bijna "onder de toren" van de Sint-Pauluskerk. Neem zeker hier een kijkje waar u nog schilderijen van Rubens, Jordaens,... kan bewonderen. Verder kan u op nog geen 600m de rijke geschiedenis van Antwerpen opsnuiven in het MAS en de oude stadskern.

ETEN & DRINKEN: In de directe omgeving vindt u talrijke terrasjes om te genieten van een Antwerps biertje of lekker eten. Om de hoek vindt u tal van restaurants, bistro en het sterrenrestaurant Nathan. Graag adviseren we u bij uw keuze.

Wij bieden zelf geen ontbijt aan, maar graag bevelen we u enkele ontbijtrestaurants aan op nog geen 5 minuten wandelen.

SHOPPING: Antwerpen is de stad bij uitstek om
host_about:
Als kind was het altijd mijn droom een eigen hotel uit te baten. Ik verzamelde jarenlang hotelfolders en speelde ook vaak reisbureautje. 

De microbe voor reizen en toerisme was aangewakkerd. 

In de middelbare school en op de Hogeschool ging ik in Brugge toerisme studeren. Uiteindelijk werk ik al enkele jaren in de financiële sector en verhuisde ik voor de liefde naar Antwerpen. Toch is de passie voor reizen en toerisme altijd gebleven.  

Met de aankoop begin 2020  van onze karaktervolle meesterwoning in Antwerpen, zag ik de kans om de draad van toerisme terug op te nemen. Enkele maanden later bieden we met “Upstairs” onze gerenoveerde gastenkamers Camille en Liselle aan om u te ontvangen. 

De authentieke elementen hebben we zoveel mogelijk proberen te bewaren, gecombineerd met een eigentijdse toets. Tegelijk bieden we u graag alle modern comfort van nieuwe privé badkamers met een inloopdouche, lavabo en toilet; Nespresso-apparaat; föhn,...

Voor de gordijnen, stoffering, bed- & badlinnen kozen we voor lokale bedrijven en Belgische kwaliteit. Het is heerlijk om na een dagje Antwerpen in slaap te vallen onder die witte percal katoenen lakens...

name: Bed and breakfast in Antwerpen · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
B&B Borgerhouse is located in the heart of Borgerhout (Antwerp), on the traffic-free Moorkensplein.

The ideal base to explore Antwerp and its surroundings from a different angle. The Moorkensplein was beautifully redeveloped a few years ago and is an attraction in the super-diverse Borgerhouse. Restaurants and shops nearby.

Antwerp Central Station, Antwerp Zoo, De Roma arts centre or Zeno X art gallery are all within walking distance. Just like the trendy Zurenborg with its listed Belle Epoque houses on the Cogels-Osylei and its cosy terraces on the Dageraadplaats. The Sportpaleis, the MAS and Park Spoor Noord are within cycling distance.
host_about:
Ik woon al mijn hele leven in Antwerpen, waarvan de laatste 20 jaar in het superdiverse Borgerhout. De voorbije jaren is hier veel ten goede veranderd. Vandaag is Borgerhout het hippe Boho en de ideale uitvalsbasis om eens iets anders in Antwerpen te ontdekken. We bouwden 2 luxueuze B&B-kamers in ons veel te grote huis op het verkeersvrije Moorkensplein, hartje Borgerhout. Verlaat eens de platgetreden toeristische paden en laat je Borgerhouts verrassen. Voor wie meer wil weten: ik schreef ondertussen het boek 'Reisgids Borgerhout, voor toevallige en blijvende passanten' (uitgeverij Luster).

===

Your host Marc
I have lived in Antwerp all my life, the last 20 years of which in the super-diverse Borgerhout. A lot has changed for the better here in recent years. Today Borgerhout is the trendy Boho and the ideal base to discover something different in Antwerp. 
We built 2 luxurious B&B rooms in our far too big house on the traffic free Moorkensplein, in the heart of Borgerhout. Leave the beaten tourist paths and let your Borgerhouts surprise you. Oh yes, at the moment I'm writing a travel guide about Borgerhout, for all coincidental and permanent passers-by... :-)

===

Votre hôte Marc
J'ai vécu toute ma vie à Anvers, dont les 20 dernières années dans le super-diversif Borgerhout. Beaucoup de choses ont changé pour le mieux ici ces dernières années. Aujourd'hui, Borgerhout est le Boho branché et la base idéale pour découvrir quelque chose de différent à Anvers. 
Nous avons construit deux chambres d'hôtes luxueuses dans notre maison beaucoup trop grande sur la Moorkensplein, au cœur de Borgerhout. Quittez les sentiers touristiques battus et laissez-vous surprendre par Borgerhouts. Oh oui, en ce moment, j'écris un guide de voyage sur Borgerhout, pour tous les passants fortuits et permanents... :-)

name: Townhouse in Antwerp · ★4.75 · 3 bedrooms · 7 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview: We can assure you that this is just the best neighborhood of Antwerp. Super central, a quiet street, close to public transfer and public parkings, in the middle of the best shopping streets and within 10 minutes walking distance from the best restaurants, cafés and museums. The district is called Sint-Andries and it is located in the southern part of the city centre. The district is bordered by the "Historical Center" in the north, the "Theaterbuurt" in the east and "Het Zuid" in the south. Nowadays, it is the fashion centre of the city and a lot of famous Belgian designers are located here. Vintage, design, interior, fashion and boutiques are key words for what to find in this area.
host_about:

Bij SHWAY voelt het alsof u logeert bij uw beste vriend, maar met de service van een hotel!
Met unieke verblijven op toplocaties in het centrum van Antwerpen, uitgebreide tips en weetjes over de stad en evenementen, soepele automatische check-ins, 24/7 bereikbaarheid en een zeer hoge standaard van de schoonmaak, zorg ik voor een gestroomlijnde en onvergetelijke city/business trip in mijn geweldige stad!

Benieuwd naar leuke hotspots om lekker te eten en te drinken in Antwerpen? Ik heb hier een aantal plekjes op een rij gezet. Allen op loopafstand :

- Poke Tiki (voor lekkere pokebowls)
- Pasta Hippo Vino (Italiaans restaurant)

- Tinsel (voor koffie of lunch)

neighborhood_overview:
Make sure your car is allowed in the city center, or in the low emission zone (cirkel in ring-road) You can check this on the site of Antwerp city 'lage emissiezone'.
If not: you can register your car or/and buy a daypass for the LEZ..
host_about:
Hi there! 

I am Son! I enjoy traveling as much as most of our guests. Cycling is my passion, for short as well as long distances.
The Antwerp Central Train Station is a short walk from my house. 
With the Metro station and rental bike stand around the corner, you can get to the old center of Antwerp in minutes, even when it's raining (which does happen in Belgium, from time to time...)

My job allows me to choose my working hours, so I can make time for my guests on arrival, or at breakfast. It's also possible to get in with keybox/code. Wifi is available, as are city guide maps. I hope to see you soon, feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

Warm greetings,
Son:)

Hey daar,  
Ik ben Son, 'doorzomerde' fietster, van een trip naar Parijs tot een rondje wereld, en heb dan ook graag reizigersvolk over de vloer, om verhalen en ervaringen te delen bij het ontbijt. Mijn huis is gelegen op korte wandelafstand van het Centraal Station Antwerpen. Mijn job laten ons meestal toe om mijn werkuren te kiezen, dus kan ik tijd vrij maken voor mijn gasten, bij ontvangst en bij het ontbijt. Het is ook mogelijk om binnen te komen met sleutelkastje/code.
Als je vragen of opmerkingen hebt, aarzel dan niet om mij te contacteren.
Graag tot gauw, en warme groeten,
Son:)

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Zeer mooie buurt met Art-nouveau huizen. Dichtbij gezellige pleintjes met gezellige terrasjes waar je lekker kan eten en drinken. De twee lekkerste bakkers van 't stad (Aldo en Dome) op minder dan 1 km wandelen. Lidl op wandelafstand, twee grote supermarkten Delhaize op fietsafstand. Parkeren in de straat is tegen betaling, maar zo goed als altijd plek! (Weektarief in de straat +-70 EUR/week
of alternatief weektarief 2 straten verder +-28 EUR/week). Op de hoek heb je een velo-station. Handig om overal naartoe te fietsen (weektarief +-10 EUR). Best op voorhand reserveren. Meer info vind je op https://www.velo-antwerpen.be/.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.82 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Ons huis is gelegen aan het oude justitiepaleis, en bevind zich dus tussen het bruisende Zuid en Centrum Antwerpen.  In onze wijk vind je bakkers, postkantoor, supermarkt en een heleboel resto's (vooral bezocht door locals). Op 10 minuten wandelen ben je in het hart van Antwerpen.
host_about:
Born and raised in the south part of the Netherlands, lived in the UK and after 2,5 years we are back in Belgium. Moving countries is mostly related to my partners (Kristof) work and it’s a great way of exploring the world.

As of this, it comes as no surprise that traveling is one of my big passions. Either it is a city break, road trip or exploring a different continent. 
I’m a big fan of nature and landscapes. I love visiting National Parks and soak in breathtaking views. But I also enjoy the culture, art and history of places and cities. 

For me the charm of AIRBNB is that your are facilitated in someones daily life and get to use their home. As this is very personal, respect is key.

Hosting guests is something we do next to our full time jobs. In my professional career i'm a mental health worker at the local psychiatric hospital.

the city district of Deurne is a vibrant and lively area with an long and tumultuous history, very close to the city centre, but also very close to nature.
The small but very nice main square with funny bars and very good shops is on walking distance, just as ‘Het Rivierenhof’ one of the most beautiful parks in Europe.
It's the first district 'outside' the city, which gives it the advantage of being very close by, though out of the busy city.

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Nice places to visit:

This cosy apartment is located 10 minutes walking from the central station in a social and cultural area.

Next to the station you can visit the Zoo of Antwerp.

Here also starts the main shopping street that leads you to the historical center with good restaurants and a view on “De Schelde”, river and the port lying next to city.

When you are here you can choose to go the cultural South or the student and harbour area in the North. Both sides have interesting bars and other places worthy to visit.

5 minutes walking from my place you have Zurenborg, a modern area with very good restaurants and bars.

Finally you can visit the central park which is located 5 minutes walking from my place.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.95 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
De Belegstraat ligt in de wijk van de Brederode. Deze interessante en bruisende buurt ligt tussen het Zuid en de Markgrave. Dit is de meest diverse buurt van Antwerpen: je vindt er de hipste koffiebars, parken, musea, theater maar je kan er ook de beste Durum eten.

Na 10 minuten stappen ben je aan het historische centrum (boerentoren, kathedraal). Evengoed ben je na tien minuten stappen aan het harmoniepark. Alles ligt binnen handbereik, zeker gegeven de verschillende vervoersmogelijkheden.

In de directe buurt zijn volgende zaken een echte aanrader:

- koffiebar Nordica - scandinavische lunch en heerlijke koffie
- brasserie Walrus - Franse keuken op zijn heerlijkst
- theater De Monty - altijd weer een beleving

Na een kleine wandeling bevelen we tevens aan:

- de Kloosterstraat - de mooiste antiekstraat van Antwerpen
- het Zuid - bruisend van horeca en het MSK

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.37 · 1 bedroom · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.
host_about: Hi, my name is Ella! I help people rent out their apartments in our beautiful city! :)

Hello from Europe,

We are expats (a Canadian and a Belgian) who spent almost two decades living and working abroad.   Our favourite country was Namibia where we enjoyed 8 fabulous years, followed closely by Brooklyn, New York, and now we're retired in Malta (which we love!).  We are so fortunate and grateful for the many amazing adventures we've enjoyed and for all of the wonderful and loving friends we've made all over the world.  

If you want more information about us, you can check out the book I wrote in Namibia as a fund-raiser for a charity I support, just to prove to you I'm authentic.   Search for Danette Jaeb - Walk a Mile in My Shoes.  I also have a website that you can find if you search for me.

We are trying our hands at hosting our apartments if and when they are available.  Bear with us as we learn how to become Airbnb hosts.   We don't have many ratings yet since we have friends often staying at our studio but have decided to take a more serious stab at this now.  

Thank you all.

Danette and Luc

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.75 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Explore Antwerp: A Fusion of Historical Charm and Modern Vibrancy

In the heart of Flanders, Antwerp is a city where history and modernity intertwine, creating a neighborhood rich in culture and contemporary allure. Wander through cobblestone streets lined with medieval architecture, highlighted by the Gothic Cathedral of Our Lady, showcasing Peter Paul Rubens' masterpieces, as well as going though the lively Grote Markt, that with its ornate guild houses, offers a glimpse into the city's vibrant past.

Antwerp's status as a fashion capital is evident in its trendy Fashion District, where chic boutiques and avant-garde designers reflect the city's stylish spirit. The Royal Academy of Fine Arts further adds to this fashionable ambiance. The city's parks and the Scheldt riverbanks provide tranquil green spaces, offering a peaceful escape from urban life.

Meanwhile, the culinary and entertainment scenes in Antwerp are equally vibrant. For food enthusiasts, y

Arne

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.39 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.65 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
De Pretstraat 72 is gelegen vlakbij de jachthaven ( het MAS ) en de oude stadskern. Nabij gelegen is het onlangs gerenoveerde Antwerps Badhuis ( art deco ) waar je rustig kan zwemmen en genieten van de wellness. Om de hoek is bistro de 'Rode 7', een plaats waar locals en kunstenaars graag vertoeven. Deze plek heeft een uniek kader en is een begrip in Antwerpen. Je kan er lekker eten aan democratische prijzen. De buurt resideert klinkende namen zoals Panamarenko, Fred Bervoets en Werner Mannaers. Deze laatste had zijn atelier op dit adres.
Kortom een perfecte locatie voor een leuke stadswandeling in het groen, een fietstocht langs de Schelde met eventueel een bezoek aan het pittoreske Bazel, Lillo of Doel, een havenrondvaart met de Flandria of het ontdekken van art-deco-gebouwen in de Cogels-Osylei, het degusteren van Belgische bieren of het exploreren van de Antwerpse gastronomie dewelke uniek is in de wereld. Typische , nabijgelegen bistro's zijn : Bistrot du Nord, Bar du Port e

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Offering a cool and trendy flat with city view, Industrial cave is set in Antwerp, 400 m from Meir and 700 m from De Keyserlei. The accommodation is 400 m from Rubenshuis, and guests benefit from private parking available on site (limited spots available €15/day) and free WiFi for all guests.

The apartment is fitted with 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom, a flat-screen TV with cable channels, a dining area, a fully equipped kitchen, and a view over the theaterplein.

A terrace is available for guests to use at the apartment.

Popular points of interest include Groenplaats Antwerp, Plantin-Moretus Museum and Astrid Square Antwerp. The nearest airport is Antwerp International Airport, 4 km from the accommodation.

This is our guests' favourite part of Antwerp, according to independent reviews.
Couples particularly like the location — they rated it 10 for a city-person trip.
host_about:
Welcome to SLEEP INN Antwerp!

We are here to offer tourists/locals/expats all-inclusive apartments on the best locations in Antwerp to explore or work in the city.

Whether you're in Antwerp alone, as an expat, as a couple for a citytrip or a family our accomodations have all the necessary you would need during your stay for both long and shortterm rentals.

All of our apartments are recently renovated and decorated with passion and style. We are located on a few central toplocations of the beautifull city Antwerpen with some of the best views. We also have a cooperation with the best gyms in Antwerp. When you make a reservation with us, you can train for free and use the wellness facilities, group sessions etc. (ask for more information)

 If you are coming to Theaterplein by car you can hire a parking spot for your car safely at our private garage closeby the apartments.

neighborhood_overview:
OLD BERCHEM - Antwerp
This is the part of Berchem that lies just inside the city's ring road, close to major access roads and at the same time a stone's throw from the beautiful old center. In addition, this residential area features beautiful homes built at the end of the 19th century and the beginning of the 20th century. Oud-Berchem can be recognized by the elegant stately mansions, beautiful belle-époque houses that used to belong to the officers and the colorful houses that can be found in picturesque hidden alleys. This neighborhood has its own park, namely the Koning Albertpark. Oud-Berchem is very accessible because of the Berchem train station and the Antwerp Ring.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: The appartment is located in a multicultural neighbourhoud, close to the station, at walking distance of the city center and the Northern park and the neighbourhood of the Island [het Eilandje].
host_about:
Wij zijn Dietrich en Sofie, uitgeweken Kempenaars naar de Koekenstad. 
We wonen in een rustig achterhuis aan het De Coninckplein en genieten van het stadsleven.
We geven je graag tips over te bezoeken restaurants, verborgen historische parels en als barista geeft Dietrich je uitgebreid uitleg over leuke koffiebars en lunchplekjes. 
Wees welkom!

De ruimte

De accomodatie is een rustige, lichte kamer met privé-badkamer. De kamer ligt gescheiden van ons huis, zodat je in alle privacy kan genieten van je verblijf.
Gelegen in een bruisende buurt van de stad, heeft u vanaf hier de perfecte uitvalsbasis om de binnenstad te bereiken.

Openbaar vervoer op 150 meter.
Historisch centrum en Eilandje zijn vlot bereikbaar.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.29 · 1 bedroom · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.84 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This is one of my favorite areas in Antwerp. The street itself is quiet but just around the corner is a lively neighborhood full of cozy bars and restaurants.

It's on walking distance from the Museum of Fine Arts, which is a famous district with lots of galleries, cozy bars and restaurants. An area all the locals go to. If you love art, this apartment might be a good place for you since the best galleries are just a few minutes away on foot.

If you walk 5min you'll be at the river side where you can enjoy the most colorful sunsets or go rollerskating or longboarding. It has a long walking boulevard and goes all the way to the other side of the city.

There is another park nearby just next to the palais of justice which is called 'konijnenwei' (Rabbit Meadow). It's more wild than other parks and a lot more peaceful. Perfect for a morning walk or picknick.

The Turkish street 'Brederode' is also closeby which makes it easy to find cheap and fres
host_about: I’m a journalism student who has a deep passion for traveling, rollerskating and drawing. Looking forward to host you in this cozy studio appartment and give you a great stay in Antwerp!

neighborhood_overview:
Explore Antwerp: A Fusion of Historical Charm and Modern Vibrancy

In the heart of Flanders, Antwerp is a city where history and modernity intertwine, creating a neighborhood rich in culture and contemporary allure. Wander through cobblestone streets lined with medieval architecture, highlighted by the Gothic Cathedral of Our Lady, showcasing Peter Paul Rubens' masterpieces, as well as going though the lively Grote Markt, that with its ornate guild houses, offers a glimpse into the city's vibrant past.

Antwerp's status as a fashion capital is evident in its trendy Fashion District, where chic boutiques and avant-garde designers reflect the city's stylish spirit. The Royal Academy of Fine Arts further adds to this fashionable ambiance. The city's parks and the Scheldt riverbanks provide tranquil green spaces, offering a peaceful escape from urban life.

I can't stress enough that this is the perfect location to discover Antwerp from!!

name: Home in Antwerpen · ★4.72 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is called the Theaterbuurt, it owes its name to the many theaters that you will find here. This is the field of activity of many directors, actors, dancers and musicians. You can almost hear the creativity bubbling in the brown bars. It is also worth a visit during the day: you will find many fashion, antique and interior shops and three small-scale but beautiful museums: the Maagdenhuismuseum and Museum Mayer Van den Bergh and the Rubenshuis.

neighborhood_overview:
Zurenborg is known for its cozy squares and beautiful residential streets with stately mansions. The Dageraadplaats is the lively center at its heart The square acts as the garden for the many young families in the area.
In the evening the lighting creates a southern atmosphere while the restaurants and terraces are usually completely full.

On Thursdays, the market stocks its stalls. A little further on is the Draakplaats where various terraces and cafes also bring a pleasant atmosphere to its stately surroundings. It is a neighborhood that is bustling and alive and considered one of, scratch that, the most aesthetic and enjoyable area(s) of the city.

name: Home in Antwerpen · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood offers a perfect blend of peace and convenience. The house is situated in a tranquil area, ensuring a peaceful and relaxing stay. You can enjoy the serene surroundings and take leisurely walks in the beautiful park nearby.

For music lovers, the popular concert venues 'De Roma' and 'TRIX' are within easy reach. You can catch some amazing live performances and immerse yourself in the vibrant music scene of Antwerp.

Despite the peaceful setting, you won't feel isolated from the buzz of the city. The historic center of Antwerp is just a short distance away, allowing you to explore the rich history and vibrant culture of the city whenever you desire.

Parking is also hassle-free in our neighborhood. You will find ample affordable parking spaces, making it convenient for those traveling by car.

If you prefer public transportation, you'll be pleased to know that we have excellent metro and tram connections nearby. Hop on a tram or me
host_about:
Hi,

I'm a Dutch guy, living in Antwerp with my 2 sons (Aaren 19, Corbijn 15).
I'm a Visual Artist and owner of graphic design studio NEW BORN UFOS and home decor label BLIKZUM. In my free time I 'm a passionate Fashion and Street Photographer.

I love Contemp. Art, Fashion,  Photography and various styles of Music (Hypnotic Techno, Post-Punk, Jazz). I look forward to sharing my passion for Art, Design & Music with you during your stay with me.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.75 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath

There are also supermarkets as Lidl, Carrefour and Delhaize in a proximity of max. 1 km. The hip neighborhood het Eilandje is also just around the corner. In other words: by coming to my place, you get the full Antwerp experience. Welcome!
host_about: Hi! I am a girl from Antwerp who loves travelling, trying new things and good food! I have recently become a host in the city I call home.

Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
I live in a vibrant neighbourhood at walking distance from the city center. around the corner you'll find organic bakeries, barista coffee bars, natural wine bars, restaurants, art galleries, a beautiful flower shop and much more.
The city center is at walking distance. I work in the city and go to work by foot every day.
host_about:
Hi! I live with my two daughters in a 1930's building with lots of original elements in a vibrant neighbourhood full of bakeries, bars and flower shops. Our place was fully renovated in 2021 and you'll find it packed with art and original design, not in the least a Judd table that sits 8 and will also be a central part during your stay in our apartment. 
I run an art gallery in the center of Antwerp which you are very welcome to visit!

neighborhood_overview: ‘t Noord heeft genoeg leuke spots. Park Spoor Noord bijvoorbeeld, een gigantisch park waar het erg goed vertoeven is. Jonge gezinnen komen er picknicken, kinderen kunnen er bij warm weer pootjebaden. Ook voor de culinaire stedentrippers is ‘t Noord een prima plek: je vindt er namelijk een paar écht goede restaurants. Ook zijn er meer dan genoeg cafés en de arthouse-cinema Klappei. Elke derde zondag van de maand kun je naar een boekenmarkt (op het De Coninckplein), waar je oude boeken koopt en van streetfood smult.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.07 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.
host_about: I help people rent out their apartments in our amazing city! I love traveling and staying in different kind of Airbnb's myself so I'm looking forward to make your stay as good as possible!

host_about:
Hoi, 

Mijn naam is Pim. Ik ben 28 jaar en ben opgegroeid in een klein dorpje (waar de Monniken hun eigen bier nog brouwen en de helft vd bevolking uit koeien bestaat) dichtbij Antwerpen. Enkele jaren geleden ben ik naar Istanbul verhuisd waar ik mijn vrouw heb leren kennen en nu wonen we samen in Antwerpen.

Ik hou reizen. Ik kan even hard genieten van een weekendje London als van dagen met de rugzak gaan rondtrekken.

name: Aparthotel in Antwerpen · ★4.78 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
“Sud d’Anvers”
Volkstraat 31
2000 Antwerpen

“Sud d’Anvers” is centrally located within the eclectic & creative district “Het Zuid” (Antwerp), with a huge range of culinary highlights, cozy bars, inspiring fashion stores and art galleries within walking distance. The neighbourhood also houses many state of the art museums, such as Muhka (Museum of Contemporary Art Antwerp), MOMU (Fashion Museum ), FOMU (Museum of Photography) and KMSKA.

name: Townhouse in Antwerpen · ★4.94 · Studio · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Je komt terecht in een leuke bruisende buurt waar je in de omliggende parken ook de rust en het groen kan opzoeken. De locatie is top om met de fiets, te voet, het openbaar vervoer, de wagen en zelfs het vliegtuig je te verplaatsen.
Dichtbij het culturele leven van Antwerpen toch rustig om te wonen.
host_about:
Laten we zeggen dat reizen mijn eerste liefde was: nieuwe mensen ontmoeten, onbekende plekken ontdekken ... Ik ben uiteraard heel blij dat mijn partner dezelfde interesse deelt en dat we dit sinds een paar jaar ook kunnen delen met onze kinderen.
In onze Airbnb hebben we al de hele wereld mogen ontvangen (al meer dan 20 nationaliteiten!) en zelf zijn we ook al de wereld afgereisd waarbij we altijd opzoek gaan naar leuke Airbnb’s.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.79 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: My neighbourhood is very alive. There’s a supermarket right under my apartment and some other shops nearby like a bakery, a butcher, etc. The Antwerp central station is 10 min walking distance from my apartment and in the big street a few meters away from my street you will find busses and trams to the city center.
host_about: Hello, I am a 27 year old student with a teaching degree in Dutch and Ethics, now doing a masters in Philosophy and Moral science. I’m from Belgium and have been living in Antwerp for the past ten years. I like to travel as much as I can and love to explore different cities and countries. I love pets, I don't smoke and I am a peaceful, quiet but very curious and adventurous person.

Remember that you have to pay 3 € tourist tax per night and per person, this is to be paid separately, separate from airbnb.

neighborhood_overview: The Big Sleep is located in the Sint-Andries district. A nice neighborhood located between the Scheldt quays where you can unwind and relax and the historic city with the Grote Markt. Typical shopping streets such as the Kloosterstraat, Steenhouwersvest, Kammenstraat and Nationalestraat embrace the district. Trendy and fashion meet brocante and antiques on the streets. And yet the vibe of a village in the heart of the city has been preserved.

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.87 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about:
Born and raised in the south part of the Netherlands, lived in the UK and after 2,5 years we are back in Belgium. Moving countries is mostly related to my partners (Kristof) work and it’s a great way of exploring the world.

As of this, it comes as no surprise that traveling is one of my big passions. Either it is a city break, road trip or exploring a different continent. 
I’m a big fan of nature and landscapes. I love visiting National Parks and soak in breathtaking views. But I also enjoy the culture, art and history of places and cities. 

For me the charm of AIRBNB is that your are facilitated in someones daily life and get to use their home. As this is very personal, respect is key.

Hosting guests is something we do next to our full time jobs. In my professional career i'm a mental health worker at the local psychiatric hospital.

neighborhood_overview:
There is always something going on in the Kloosterstraat in Antwerp (even on Sunday). The street is bustling with activity. On weekdays, you can enjoy a lot of creativity, passion and a unique offer. The Kloosterstraat is a household name. Those who have never been there cannot understand it. Those who have lost their hearts there have no equal.
A part from the Kloosterstraat, the apartment is close to all bars & restaurants located in the vibrant center of Antwerpen-Zuid.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.83 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood, called ‘Seefhoek’ among locals, is a vibrant, multicultural area harboring many small local shops. The Winkelhaak design centre, the public library Permeke, supermarket Criee (famous for its butcher shops) and China town are just around the corner, Central Station and the Zoo are a 10-minute walk, the famous shopping street Meir another 5 minutes further. Beer lovers will want to check out Beer lovers bar and coffee lovers will find something of their liking at Viggo’s, both located at Coninckplein. Several mediterranean fish restaurants are located in the Handelsstraat, where you can also find the folkloric restaurant Den Beer, famous for its lobster. For great freshly-baked pizza, check out Loes & Krikke in the Congresstraat.

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.73 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
host_about:
Ik ben 35 jaar en woon samen met mijn dochter en partner in het groene Grobbendonk. Ik heb op Antwerpen Zuid gewoond en het is een heerlijke stad om in te wonen of te verblijven. Het voelt als vakantie, elke keer als je buiten stapt. Er is zoveel te beleven. Je krijgt er niet genoeg van. 

Ik kijk er naar uit om jullie te ontmoeten!

neighborhood_overview:
Toffe rustige buurt,
100m verder begint het bruisend stadsleven op de Turnhoutsebaan (Walhalla aan betaalbare eetplekjes.
Hier kan je de Metro & Tram nemen naar centrum, Zuid...

Zo bent u op 5 min tijd in Centraal station.
op 15 min bent u aan het MAS.

Op wandelafstand heb je gezellige krugerplein & dageraadsplaats.

Ook Prima gelegen om een nachtje in de Roma of de Trix door te brengen.
Zelfs het Sportpaleis is gemakkelijk te bereiken met fiets, tram of Uber...

Sportpaleis (3-4km)
Trixx (2km)
The Roma (200m)
