name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: We bevinden ons in de bruisende wijk het Zuid recht tegenover het KMSKA museum. De wijk heeft een ongekende en uitgebreide keuze aan restaurants en bars. Warenhuizen, top slagers traiteurs, groentewinkels, alles is op wandelafstand. Boetieks en verschillende gallerijen maken de wijk compleet.  Talrijke  musea liggen op wandelafstand. De oude stad met zijn kathedraal ligt op een kwartiertje wandelen. Extra service mogelijk. Dit geldt voor linnen, schoonmaak of een gevulde ijskast.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.88 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
It's a young and family-oriented neighbourhood. Not touristy at all: right across from our door you have cool coffee bar Copper, owned by our neighbour, and exquisite vegan restaurant And/or. A new and hidden gem, at the moment only locals have discovered it! There are many supermarkets and nice little bars, as well as park Hof Van Leysen.
But don't be mistaken: the hustle and bustle of Antwerp-Zuid is right nearby. In under ten minutes walking you will find yourself at the steps of the world-class, newly renovated Museum of Fine Arts (MUHKA) at Museumplein. The area around it (nicknamed Petit Paris) is famous for its little squares with winebars, art galeries and many, many shops. You could walk around there for days and still not get bored.
Just a few more streets ahead you arrive at the bank of the river Schelde, good for long, introspective walks and sightseeing all the unique architectural riverside appartments. It's Antwerp at it finest: classic grandeur meets flashy

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Antwerpen is de allerleukste stad van België. Niet alleen omdat het zo'n beeldschone stad is om te zien, maar je kunt er waanzinnig goed shoppen, lekker eten en zeker ook op cultureel gebied is er veel te ontdekken. Voor het mooiste en leukste deel van de stad zak je af naar Antwerpen Zuid. Hier vind je niet alleen de beste hotspots op culinair gebied maar zijn ook een hoop toffe dingen te doen.

De studio is op 500m van de Marnixplaats gelegen. Hier vind je op 1 plein alle IT-cafés 'van 't stad' waar ook de locals rond hangen. Vitrine, De Baron, Soho, De Hopper, .. om er maar enkele te noemen.
Bovendien zijn ook de lekkerste restaurants hier te vinden. Wat dacht je van Fiskebar, Den Artist of Pilar?
Het KMSKA, De Scheldekaaien, De Kloosterstraat, het MUHKA, FOMU, .. bijna alle (culturele) bezienswaardigheden zijn gelegen in deze bruisende buurt.

Als je komt voor shoppen, eten, drinken of gewoon genieten; opt Zuid kan het allemaal!

De studio li

If you would like to know more about Antwerp; we know the best places to eat, drink and go out!

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.78 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
In the heart of Flanders, Antwerp is a city where history and modernity intertwine, creating a neighborhood rich in culture and contemporary allure. Wander through cobblestone streets lined with medieval architecture, highlighted by the Gothic Cathedral of Our Lady, showcasing Peter Paul Rubens' masterpieces, as well as going though the lively Grote Markt, that with its ornate guild houses, offers a glimpse into the city's vibrant past.

Antwerp's status as a fashion capital is evident in its trendy Fashion District, where chic boutiques and avant-garde designers reflect the city's stylish spirit. The Royal Academy of Fine Arts further adds to this fashionable ambiance. The city's parks and the Scheldt riverbanks provide tranquil green spaces, offering a peaceful escape from urban life.

Meanwhile, the culinary and entertainment scenes in Antwerp are equally vibrant. For food enthusiasts, you can enjoy Belgian chocolates and waffles at cozy cafes, or savor modern Fl
host_about:
Hello, my name is Arne and I’m 26 years old. Love to travel, meet new people and see new places. I enjoy life and try to make the best of it.
If you planned a trip to Antwerp, let me know and I could arrange you a great stay in beautiful apartments. 

Greetings 
Arne

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
For some people Antwerp is just the train stop between Paris and Amsterdam. And you really need to know the good places, because Antwerp has a lot to offer! It is magnet for new hot spots! As a host, I have my own interior & food agency, so I can provide you with the best hotspots in the neighbourhood, perfect for a family or friends weekend.

It's a perfect mix of old and new. Old: the medieval city centre, amazing buildings that were still preserved, the home of painter Pieter Paul Rubens, the port where emigration started to the US, the list goes on. Antwerp is also a fashion & design capital! Sure it’s not Paris or Milan, but it has the Antwerp six: Belgium’s most influential avant-garde fashion collective. And that means: let the shopping begin!

Visit Antwerp's historic city center, a city full of ancient heritage, musea, nice restaurants, bars and shops. Everything is at walking distance, from the Grand Central (750m) to the famous Meir (800m) and 't Eiland
host_about:
A 32-years old interior & foodie enthusiast living in Antwerp. I love being a host here and offer guests a homely & comfortable place to stay, along with a smooth & worry-less Airbnb experience.

I have my own creative communication agency, specialized in design & architecture. So I really love beautiful interiors where it feels like home. Nice to know: me and my mom have a  knitwear label called Mouaire, which stands for handmade sustainable  mohair pieces.

Welcome to SLEEP INN Antwerp!

We are here to offer tourists/locals/expats all-inclusive apartments on the best locations in Antwerp to explore or work in the city.

Whether you're in Antwerp alone, as an expat, as a couple for a citytrip or a family our accomodations have all the necessary you would need during your stay for both long and shortterm rentals.

All of our apartments are recently renovated and decorated with passion and style. We are located on a few central toplocations of the beautifull city Antwerpen with some of the best views. We also have a cooperation with the best gyms in Antwerp. When you make a reservation with us, you can train for free and use the wellness facilities, group sessions etc. (ask for more information)

host_about:
Hi! My name is Charlotte, and I'm thrilled to share my passion for interior design, hospitality, and my hometown of Antwerp with you.

As your host, I'll be available to help you throughout your stay and answer any questions you may have. I'm a proud local of Antwerp, and I'm always happy to share my favorite places to eat, drink, and explore the city.

If you love the interior design of my airbnb's, everything is for sale! Simply let me know if you're interested in purchasing any of the items.

I can't wait to host you in Antwerp and share all that this wonderful city has to offer.

Hi there I'm Tobias. 
I'm born and raised in Antwerp and I hope to be able to welcome you here. 
What I really love about the city is that it has everything you need but its still cosy and small so you can do everything by foot or bike. 
I'm born to a dutch father and brazilian mom and like to learn new languages and learn new cultures. I'm fluent in English, Dutch and Portuguese  and can speak a bit of french, spanish and german. Its nice that I can practice these languages some more while hosting! 
One of my Biggest passions is music and I'm lucky to be able to work with it. 

See you soon!

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Zuid
Het Zuid heeft voor vele Antwerpenaren en bezoekers prachtige bezienswaardigheden. Je vindt er authentieke herenhuizen, wijde boulevards en mooie pleinen.
Kunstliefhebbers kunnen de vele kunstgalerijen bezoeken, alsook de belangrijkste musea van de stad. Zoals het KMSKA, Koninklijke museum voor Schone Kunsten dat recent zijn deuren opende na 11 jaar renovatie, alsook het M HKA, Museum van Hedendaagse kunst en het FOMU, Fotomuseum.
In de Kloosterstraat kan je gezellig sluieren en opzoek gaan naar vintage en prachtige meubelstukken.
Je bent omringd door vele populaire cafés en restaurants, dus je kan je laten meeslepen in deze bruisend buurt.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.59 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Home in Antwerpen · ★4.50 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The old city centre is steeped in history. You will find it in ancient building-fronts on narrow streets or in the imposing Grand-Place. The Plantin-Moretus Museum is the only museum in the world to be classified as a Unesco World Heritage site. In the shadow of the Cathedral of Our Lady, the city teems with life in intimate pubs and restaurants. The banks of the Scheldt are a great place for a breath of fresh air.

Antwerp is a world city on a human scale. There’s always something to see and experience from interesting museums and fun attractions to surprising spots and architectural highlights.

"Finger-licking good food? Antwerp is the place to be! Experience the city's welcoming terraces on the many squares and, in addition to Belgian staples such as fries and chocolate, sample local delicacies such as the beer "Bolleke" and the liqueur "Elixir d'Anvers".

Whether you’re a quiet connoisseur, stern onlooker or boogie wonder, Antwerp’s nightlife is unfai

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in Berchem-Antwerpen, a suburb very close to Antwerp city and the Antwerp Ring highway. A Delhaize supermarket is located across the street, 50 meter from the apartment and you find bakers, butchers and many shops nearby.
The neighborhood is green and quiet for city standards.
Parking is generally available at the property and you have easy access to bus, tram and train within walking distance.
There are several restaurants and bistros also in walking distance.
The place is ideally located to visit the Middelheim Park or take a bus or tram to immerse yourself in the vivid Antwerp city life.
From the nearby Antwerpen-Berchem railway station you have frequent trains going West, South and East, making your journey to other cities across Belgium easy.
The international train Belgian-The Netherlands also has a stop every hour. This train also provides connection to Zaventem Airport and Schiphol or Eindhoven Airport in The Netherlands.
host_about:
I am Joseph and have been a user of short term rental stays myself for years.
From this experience i saw a need for fully equiped accomodations catering to Business Travelers, Digital Nomads, Remote Workers and Demanding Tourists.
Hence we created Regency Comfort, dedicated to provide such accomodations. 
Our houses and flats stand for a hassle-free stay and a home-away-from-home experience, contrasting with the often impersonal hotel approach.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.74 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Home in Antwerpen · ★4.78 · 5 bedrooms · 6 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Oud-Berchem is a popular Antwerp neighborhood with a mix of cozy cafes, wonderful restaurants, old mansions, co-working spaces, child-friendly parks, supermarkets and nice local shops.

Be sure to visit Brouwerij De Coninck, Antwerp's iconic beer brewery that has been transformed into a culinary hotspot where you can get the best beer, meat or cheese. Delicious dining there on the roof terrace of Black Smoke is also an absolute must.

PAKT is also definitely worth a visit. With a nice mix of cozy coffee houses and restaurants, a roof farm, playground, fitness and a beautiful green courtyard in a setting that is reminiscent of Berlin. A real hidden city gem!

With Vin D'Où and star restaurant The Jane, you have two top restaurants within walking distance.

You can reach the center in no time by train (4 min), bicycle (9 min) or tram (14 min). Our house is located about 200 meters from Antwerp-Berchem station.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.76 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This apartment is located in the historical Antwerp area "Den Dam". Amongst other things known for its superb restaurants. Be sure to try "Piétran" if you love a good steak, or the very unique "Veranda" if originality is what you are looking for.

You also have a very alround grocery store down the street, where you can find all that you need (it's closed only on thursdays).

The spacious park "Spoor Noord" is directly around the corner (less than half a minute walk). It connects this place with the modern and trendy area "Het Eilandje" with its marina and the world famous MAS-museum.

From there, it's just a 20-minute walk (or quick bike ride) to the city center with its magnificent Cathedral.

neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.
host_about: Hi, my name is Ella! I help people rent out their apartments in our beautiful city! :)

name: Home in Antwerpen · ★4.90 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The Sebastian is located in one of the most cozy and buzzing neighborhoods of Antwerp, Zurenborg. The "Dageraadplaats' is just at your doorstep where you can find numerous hip bars, classic café's, great restaurants and a popular playground for the little ones. Zurenborg is also famous for its gorgeous Belle Epoque architecture that is all around you. The shopping district and the old city are just a bike or tram ride away but there is no other place like this 'village in the city' to stay and make your Antwerp experience complete.
host_about:
I live in Antwerp with my husband and kids. I love travel, discovering things with my family and my city, Antwerp.

With my husband Dominic I host the lovely Annabellahuisje in Sluis and two flats in Antwerp.

Together my friend Caroline I host guests in our beautiful house in Antwerp. We renovated and decorated it with great care and personal taste.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
host_about:
Hi there I'm Tobias. 
I'm born and raised in Antwerp and I hope to be able to welcome you here. 
What I really love about the city is that it has everything you need but its still cosy and small so you can do everything by foot or bike. 
I'm born to a dutch father and brazilian mom and like to learn new languages and learn new cultures. I'm fluent in English, Dutch and Portuguese  and can speak a bit of french, spanish and german. Its nice that I can practice these languages some more while hosting! 
One of my Biggest passions is music and I'm lucky to be able to work with it. 

See you soon!

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · 1 bedroom · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

Welcome to SLEEP INN Antwerp!

We are here to offer tourists/locals/expats all-inclusive apartments on the best locations in Antwerp to explore or work in the city.

Whether you're in Antwerp alone, as an expat, as a couple for a citytrip or a family our accomodations have all the necessary you would need during your stay for both long and shortterm rentals.

All of our apartments are recently renovated and decorated with passion and style. We are located on a few central toplocations of the beautifull city Antwerpen with some of the best views. We also have a cooperation with the best gyms in Antwerp. When you make a reservation with us, you can train for free and use the wellness facilities, group sessions etc. (ask for more information)

neighborhood_overview:
We’re in the heart of Antwerp's historic city center, overlooking the UNESCO Cathedral of Our Lady, the square (Groenplaats) and old city quarter (The Grote Markt).

The Groenplaats square is a popular meeting spot for both locals and tourists alike, with its many outdoor cafes and restaurants offering a perfect spot to enjoy a drink or meal while watching the world go by. You can also explore Antwerp's most famous street "Meir" filled with a mix of high-end designer stores and independent boutiques, offering something for everyone.

Surrounded by elegant buildings, picturesque cobblestone streets, and stunning architecture, this vibrant area is steeped in history and culture.
From the magnificent Cathedral of Our Lady to the magnificent Town Hall, there is no shortage of architectural marvels to admire in this area, including "Vlaeykensgang", Antwerp's oldest street that is over 420 years old still kept to its original condition.

In the historic
host_about:
Hi! I am Lucy, born in Hong Kong, grew up in Australia and now living in Belgium. I am a property manager, Health IT consultant & the Director of Cozy Antwerp - www.cozyantwerp,com!. 
I specialise in short & mid term rentals dedicated to families and business travellers. I can also help you pre-arrange activities or organise a special occasion during your stay. Just tell me what you need and I’ll do the rest!

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.67 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The old city centre is steeped in history. You will find it in ancient building-fronts on narrow streets or in the imposing Grand-Place. The Plantin-Moretus Museum is the only museum in the world to be classified as a Unesco World Heritage site. In the shadow of the Cathedral of Our Lady, the city teems with life in intimate pubs and restaurants. The banks of the Scheldt are a great place for a breath of fresh air.

Antwerp is a world city on a human scale. There’s always something to see and experience from interesting museums and fun attractions to surprising spots and architectural highlights.

"Finger-licking good food? Antwerp is the place to be! Experience the city's welcoming terraces on the many squares and, in addition to Belgian staples such as fries and chocolate, sample local delicacies such as the beer "Bolleke" and the liqueur "Elixir d'Anvers".

Whether you’re a quiet connoisseur, stern onlooker or boogie wonder, Antwerp’s nightlife is unfai

Hospitality regards,
Team HUSWELL

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.75 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located a 15min walk from the Central Station and is located in the upcoming and trendy neighbourhood of Park Spoor Noord, which is a large urban park with a summer bar and lots of green areas for picnicking or sports. The historical City Centre, the shopping streets, the trendy “Eilandje” with a.o. several of the landmark museums of Antwerp, the marina and lots of nice bars and restaurants are all only a short walk away. A great staging area for a visit of Antwerp! The new Cadix hospital as well as a large number of university buildings are also located nearby.

neighborhood_overview:
Ontdek de charme van Het Eilandje, een levendige en trendy wijk in Antwerpen, vanuit ons gastvrije appartement. Deze historische havenwijk is getransformeerd tot een modern en hip stedelijk gebied, maar heeft zijn maritieme ziel behouden.

Geniet van de mix van oude pakhuizen, moderne architectuur, en het bruisende leven aan het water. Proef de lokale keuken in de vele uitstekende restaurants en cafés, of geniet van een wandeling langs de jachthaven en bewonder de boten en jachten. Bezoek de historische droogdokken, of duik in het nachtleven in de vele bars en clubs.

Met talrijke kunstgalerijen, ambachtelijke winkels, en boetieks om te verkennen, is 'Het Eilandje' de perfecte plek om het bruisende Antwerpen te ervaren. Met de nabijheid van het openbaar vervoer is reizen door de stad vanuit deze wijk eenvoudig en gemakkelijk.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Explore Antwerp: A Fusion of Historical Charm and Modern Vibrancy

In the heart of Flanders, Antwerp is a city where history and modernity intertwine, creating a neighborhood rich in culture and contemporary allure. Wander through cobblestone streets lined with medieval architecture, highlighted by the Gothic Cathedral of Our Lady, showcasing Peter Paul Rubens' masterpieces, as well as going though the lively Grote Markt, that with its ornate guild houses, offers a glimpse into the city's vibrant past.

Antwerp's status as a fashion capital is evident in its trendy Fashion District, where chic boutiques and avant-garde designers reflect the city's stylish spirit. The Royal Academy of Fine Arts further adds to this fashionable ambiance. The city's parks and the Scheldt riverbanks provide tranquil green spaces, offering a peaceful escape from urban life.

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
De studio bevindt zich op de leien, ter hoogte van het oud centrum.

Eens je buitenkomt en je gaat rechtdoor beland je op de Meir, de place to be indien je graag wil gaan shoppen.
Een beetje verderop vind je de grote markt en de kathedraal met tal van leuke barretjes en restaurants.

Ga je naar rechts als je de studio uitgaat, dan kom je ten einde aan het eilandje, waar je het MAS ziet, de dokken met alle bootjes en tal van restaurants. In de zomer zijn hier ook heel leuke beach bars terug te vinden.
host_about: Zelf ben ik als kind opgegroeid in Antwerpen. Hier heb ik gewoond tot mijn 25e. Vandaag werk ik hier nog steeds en ik vind het fantastisch hoe bruisend deze stad is. Veel leuke koffiebars, restaurant, cocktailbars, heel gevarieerd en altijd in beweging.

In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

Welcome to SLEEP INN Antwerp!

We are here to offer tourists/locals/expats all-inclusive apartments on the best locations in Antwerp to explore or work in the city.

Whether you're in Antwerp alone, as an expat, as a couple for a citytrip or a family our accomodations have all the necessary you would need during your stay for both long and shortterm rentals.

All of our apartments are recently renovated and decorated with passion and style. We are located on a few central toplocations of the beautifull city Antwerpen with some of the best views. We also have a cooperation with the best gyms in Antwerp. When you make a reservation with us, you can train for free and use the wellness facilities, group sessions etc. (ask for more information)

 If you are coming to Theaterplein by car you can hire a parking spot for your car safely at our private garage closeby the apartments.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.96 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.16 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The South ("Het Zuid") in Antwerp is a currently fashionable area of Antwerp. Revived in the mid-1980s, it has an attractive street plan and a few Art Nouveau buildings, such as the former Volkshuis (or Maison du Peuple) on the Volkstraat. Three museums, numerous commercial art galleries, fashionable cafes and restaurants, two arts' centres and a sprinkling of up-market shops add to the attractions of the area.

There is so much to see and do here. The architecture is outstanding, your near the docklands and the river and some of the great bars, pubs and restaurants are amazing places to visit.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.70 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Paardenmarkt, nestled in the heart of Antwerp, Belgium, is an enchanting and historic district.

This picturesque enclave is renowned for its charming cobblestone streets, quaint architectural wonders, and an animated ambiance that effortlessly marries the allure of yesteryears with contemporary vitality.

The district's name, "Horse Market," harkens back to its historical prominence as a trading hub for equines. Today, Paardenmarkt is a thriving neighborhood, replete with inviting cafes, boutique shops, and cultural treasures, rendering it an essential stop for those keen on exploring Antwerp's rich heritage.

With its warm and welcoming atmosphere, Paardenmarkt offers a delightful window into the city's past, all the while remaining an effervescent part of its present.
host_about:
Welcome to our enchanting apartment in Antwerp! 

As two worldly sisters, we've embraced diverse cultures across Guatemala, Germany, Italy, Israel, and beyond. Fluent in English, Spanish, German, Portuguese, Italian, and Hebrew, we bridge language barriers effortlessly. 

Our shared passion for excellence ensures your stay becomes an unforgettable home-away-from-home experience. 

Join us in creating cherished memories in our beautiful apartment.

neighborhood_overview:
The old city centre is steeped in history. You will find it in ancient building-fronts on narrow streets or in the imposing Grand-Place. The Plantin-Moretus Museum is the only museum in the world to be classified as a Unesco World Heritage site. In the shadow of the Cathedral of Our Lady, the city teems with life in intimate pubs and restaurants. The banks of the Scheldt are a great place for a breath of fresh air.

Antwerp is a world city on a human scale. There’s always something to see and experience from interesting museums and fun attractions to surprising spots and architectural highlights.

"Finger-licking good food? Antwerp is the place to be! Experience the city's welcoming terraces on the many squares and, in addition to Belgian staples such as fries and chocolate, sample local delicacies such as the beer "Bolleke" and the liqueur "Elixir d'Anvers".

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.69 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Explore Antwerp: A Fusion of Historical Charm and Modern Vibrancy

In the heart of Flanders, Antwerp is a city where history and modernity intertwine, creating a neighborhood rich in culture and contemporary allure. Wander through cobblestone streets lined with medieval architecture, highlighted by the Gothic Cathedral of Our Lady, showcasing Peter Paul Rubens' masterpieces, as well as going though the lively Grote Markt, that with its ornate guild houses, offers a glimpse into the city's vibrant past.

Antwerp's status as a fashion capital is evident in its trendy Fashion District, where chic boutiques and avant-garde designers reflect the city's stylish spirit. The Royal Academy of Fine Arts further adds to this fashionable ambiance. The city's parks and the Scheldt riverbanks provide tranquil green spaces, offering a peaceful escape from urban life.

Meanwhile, the culinary and entertainment scenes in Antwerp are equally vibrant. For food enthusiasts, y

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.73 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Sint-Paulusstraat in Antwerp boasts a vibrant neighborhood filled with an array of delightful attractions. Explore the cobbled streets lined with charming boutiques, trendy cafes, and artisanal shops, offering a unique shopping experience. Immerse yourself in the rich history of the area by visiting the iconic St. Paul's Church, known for its stunning baroque architecture and impressive art collection.

Indulge your taste buds with a variety of culinary delights as you discover the neighborhood's diverse dining scene. From cozy cafes serving freshly brewed coffee and pastries to exquisite restaurants offering local and international cuisine, there is something to satisfy every palate.

For art enthusiasts, the Royal Museum of Fine Arts is just a short stroll away. Immerse yourself in the world of masterpieces by renowned artists, showcasing a range of artistic styles and periods.

neighborhood_overview:
Embark on a captivating journey through Antwerp, starting from the enchanting Venusstraat. As you step out onto the vibrant streets, you'll find yourself immersed in a city teeming with history, culture, and architectural wonders.

Begin your exploration by strolling through the charming cobbled lanes, where you'll encounter a delightful blend of boutique shops, art galleries, and inviting cafes. Take your time to browse through the unique offerings, from fashionable clothing and accessories to local artisan crafts and antique treasures.

As you venture further, you'll find yourself captivated by the awe-inspiring beauty of the Cathedral of Our Lady. Its towering spires and intricate Gothic architecture will leave you in awe. Step inside to marvel at the exquisite works of art by masters like Rubens and Van Dyck that adorn its walls.

Continue your journey to the majestic Grote Markt, a bustling square brimming with historical charm. Admire the stunning Br

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Welkom bij ons gezellige appartement in Linkeroever, de perfecte uitvalsbasis voor een onvergetelijk verblijf in Antwerpen! Laat me je meenemen op een reis door onze buurt en ontdek waarom het de ideale locatie is voor je volgende avontuur.

Ons appartement is rustig gelegen aan een charmant pleintje, omringd door de heerlijke geuren van twee bakkerijen, een frituur en een pizzeria. Je kunt de dag beginnen met een verse croissant en genieten van een smakelijke lokale lunch op het pleintje. Voor een ontspannen avond kun je hier ook terecht voor een knapperige pizza of een portie Vlaamse frietjes.

Aan de overkant van het pleintje schittert de imposante blauwe kerk, omgeven door weelderig groen. Het is een idyllisch zicht dat je meteen in vakantiestemming brengt. En als je zin hebt om even uit te waaien, hoef je alleen maar de straat over te steken en een rustige wandeling te maken in de omliggende groene omgeving.

Als het gaat om parkeren, hoef je je geen

neighborhood_overview:
The old city centre is steeped in history. You will find it in ancient building-fronts on narrow streets or in the imposing Grand-Place. The Plantin-Moretus Museum is the only museum in the world to be classified as a Unesco World Heritage site. In the shadow of the Cathedral of Our Lady, the city teems with life in intimate pubs and restaurants. The banks of the Scheldt are a great place for a breath of fresh air.

Antwerp is a world city on a human scale. There’s always something to see and experience from interesting museums and fun attractions to surprising spots and architectural highlights.

"Finger-licking good food? Antwerp is the place to be! Experience the city's welcoming terraces on the many squares and, in addition to Belgian staples such as fries and chocolate, sample local delicacies such as the beer "Bolleke" and the liqueur "Elixir d'Anvers".

Whether you’re a quiet connoisseur, stern onlooker or boogie wonder, Antwerp’s nightlife is unfai

This up-and-coming area is known for its contemporary charm and is highly regarded by both locals and visitors. With its new infrastructure and well-maintained streets, Nieuw Zuid provides a pleasant environment for residents and visitors alike.

Within the neighborhood itself, you'll find an array of fantastic cafes and food places, offering a diverse range of culinary delights. Whether you're craving a cozy coffee shop experience or seeking out delicious meals, Nieuw Zuid has a variety of options to satisfy your palate.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1 bath
Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★3.78 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.
host_about: I help people rent out their apartments in our amazing city! I love traveling and staying in different kind of Airbnb's myself so I'm looking forward to make your stay as good as possible!

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Condo in Antwerpen · ★4.70 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Antwerpen wordt ook wel dé modestad genoemd en dat kan je in deze buurt volop ontdekken...

Op de Meir vind je voornamelijk de grote ketens. Kijk niet alleen naar de etalages maar bewonder ook de adembenemende architectuur van de winkelpanden uit de 18de en 19de eeuw.

Hou je meer van hip en trendy dan is de Kammenstraat zeker een bezoekje waard. De Nationalestraat en de omliggende straten, waaronder Lombarden- en Steenhouwersvest, vormen het modieuze hart van Antwerpen.

Voor iedereen die geïnteresseerd is in geschiedenis, monumenten en sfeervolle pleinen en steegjes... ook het historisch centrum is vlakbij.

Daarnaast zijn andere wijken zoals 't Zuid, 't Eilandje, Zurenborg of Diamand zeker een bezoekje waard.
host_about:
Vorm een gelukkig gezinnetje met mijn man en een kleine kapoen June. 
Ben gepassioneerd door reizen, fotografie en lekker eten. 
En hecht veel belang aan quality time met familie & vrienden.

Home in Antwerpen · ★4.59 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Explore Antwerp: A Fusion of Historical Charm and Modern Vibrancy

In the heart of Flanders, Antwerp is a city where history and modernity intertwine, creating a neighborhood rich in culture and contemporary allure. Wander through cobblestone streets lined with medieval architecture, highlighted by the Gothic Cathedral of Our Lady, showcasing Peter Paul Rubens' masterpieces, as well as going though the lively Grote Markt, that with its ornate guild houses, offers a glimpse into the city's vibrant past.

Antwerp's status as a fashion capital is evident in its trendy Fashion District, where chic boutiques and avant-garde designers reflect the city's stylish spirit. The Royal Academy of Fine Arts further adds to this fashionable ambiance. The city's parks and the Scheldt riverbanks provide tranquil green spaces, offering a peaceful escape from urban life.

Meanwhile, the culinary and entertainment scenes in Antwerp are equally vibrant. For food enthusiasts, y

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Guesthouse in Antwerpen · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: The building is located in the traditional student area, right in the heart of Antwerp. This area is located between the historical city center with the impressive Cathedral, the most polular Belgian shopping street (‘Meir’) and the old harbour area which became one of the most trendy parts of the city. Within approximately 1km walking you find cosy and romantic squares, Antwerp’s most popular museums, trendy shops, from cheap to 3 star restaurants (and everything between this),  open views over the river, the most beautiful railway station in the world, etc. It is the ideal location to discover everything that Antwerp has to offer.

Within approximately 1km walking you find cosy and romantic squares, Antwerp’s most popular museums, trendy shops, from cheap to 3 star restaurants (and everything between this),  open views over the river, the most beautiful railway station in the world, etc. It is the ideal location to discover everything that Antwerp has to offer.

name: Home in Antwerpen · ★4.92 · 4 bedrooms · 9 beds · 3.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Het huis ligt midden in de bossen, op een privéterrein waar u kunt genieten van de rust en het vogelgezang.
Houd er aub rekening mee dat het een rustige buurt is, dus na 22 uur is luide muziek niet toegestaan.
Het ligt vlakbij het kasteel Klaverblad (privé) en niet ver van de golf van Cleydael.
Er zijn aangename restaurants in de buurt (Aartselaar of Wilrijk).
De afstand tussen de kathedraal van Antwerpen en het huis is een kleine 10 km.
Aan de overkant van de Schelde (te bereiken met de waterbus), bevinden zich de Polders van Kruibeke, een natuurreservaat en wandelparadijs ook met erfgoed (kasteel/museum Wissekerke). Vlakbij, kunt u het gezellige polderdorpje van Bazel bezoeken.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.59 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Explore Antwerp: A Fusion of Historical Charm and Modern Vibrancy

In the heart of Flanders, Antwerp is a city where history and modernity intertwine, creating a neighborhood rich in culture and contemporary allure. Wander through cobblestone streets lined with medieval architecture, highlighted by the Gothic Cathedral of Our Lady, showcasing Peter Paul Rubens' masterpieces, as well as going though the lively Grote Markt, that with its ornate guild houses, offers a glimpse into the city's vibrant past.

Antwerp's status as a fashion capital is evident in its trendy Fashion District, where chic boutiques and avant-garde designers reflect the city's stylish spirit. The Royal Academy of Fine Arts further adds to this fashionable ambiance. The city's parks and the Scheldt riverbanks provide tranquil green spaces, offering a peaceful escape from urban life.

Meanwhile, the culinary and entertainment scenes in Antwerp are equally vibrant. For food enthusiasts, y

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★2.67 · 2 bedrooms · 6 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★3.67 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The old city centre is steeped in history. You will find it in ancient building-fronts on narrow streets or in the imposing Grand-Place. The Plantin-Moretus Museum is the only museum in the world to be classified as a Unesco World Heritage site. In the shadow of the Cathedral of Our Lady, the city teems with life in intimate pubs and restaurants. The banks of the Scheldt are a great place for a breath of fresh air.

Antwerp is a world city on a human scale. There’s always something to see and experience from interesting museums and fun attractions to surprising spots and architectural highlights.

"Finger-licking good food? Antwerp is the place to be! Experience the city's welcoming terraces on the many squares and, in addition to Belgian staples such as fries and chocolate, sample local delicacies such as the beer "Bolleke" and the liqueur "Elixir d'Anvers".

ABOUT ME

A small girl who wants to explore the big world! 
I enjoy life in every way it's possible: traveling, cooking (and eating), drinking some good wine and beers, meeting new and interesting people, exploring myself, reading and writing, going to festivals and concerts, snowboarding, being active (or trying to be), taking pictures (because my memory is sooo bad),... 
I'm a very happy person. Glad to be young!

INTERESTS

Photography, snowboarding, going out with friends, reading, enjoy good food and wine, nature, hiking, other sports, writing, cooking, music and festivals... ENJOY LIFE!

MUSIC, MOVIES & BOOKS

Movies: Moonrise Kingdom, Up, A Clockwork Orange, Amélie Poulain, The Curious Case of Benjamin Button, Finding Nemo, No country for old men, Into the wild, Black Swan, Eternal sunshine of a spotless mind, Django Unchained,...

Music: I like a lot of different kind of music. I really like to go festivals! 
The XX, Eels, Mumford and Sons, Red Hot Chili Peppers, The Beatles, The Doors, Macy Gray, Isbells, Editors, Fleet Foxes, Ben Howard, Bon Iver, Foo fighters, Band of Skulls, Arctic Monkeys, Absynthe Minded, Vampire Weekend, The Vaccines, Tracy Chapman, Simon & Garfunkel, Queen of the Stone Ages, Oasis, The National, The Kinks, Kasabian, Johnny Cash, Gotye, Geppetto and the Whales, The Beach Boys, Arcade Fire, Sigur Ros, The Smiths, Massive Attack, Coely, Bonobo, Flume, Franz Ferdinand, Pixies, Band of Horses, Trixie Whitley, Brandom Flowers, MGMT, The Chemical Brothers, ...

ONE AMAZING THING I'VE DONE

- Roadtrip in Greece with three other friends 
- Roadtrip France with seven other friends 
- Lived for 9 weeks in Vancouver 
- Roadtrip Vancouver Island by my own 
- Roadtrip Rocky Mountains with my boyfriend 
- Roadtrip in East-Canada with my family 
- Citytrips in Europe: Rome, Lisbon, Barcelona, London, Paris, Budapest, Amsterdam, Brussels, Florence, Venice, Berlin, Copenhagen, Stockholm, Bologna, Milan, Marakesh,... 
- Festivals in Belgium: Pukkelpop, Gentse Feesten, Rock Werchter, Dour, Les Ardents, Antilliaanse Feesten, Tomorrowland, Best Kept Secret (Netherlands),...
- Trip to Iceland
- Trip to Denmark and Faroer Islands
- Trip to Maroc with 4 other friends 

TEACH, LEARN, SHARE

Be grateful. 
Be yourself. 
Be happy.

***

PHILOSOPHY

When I was 5 years old, my mother always told me that happiness was the key to life. When I went to school, they asked me what I wanted to be when I grew up. I wrote down 'happy'. They told me I didn't understand the assignment, and I told them they didn't understand life. - 
John Lennon

Be happy and grateful with everything you have and get. I'm happy and grateful with everything I have and get!

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The "Eilandje" district is the oldest port area in Antwerp and is surrounded by water. Today the port activity is more concentrated in the north, but the port feeling still dominates here. Taste the old atmosphere of the unloading quay with monumental warehouses, lanterns, hangars and cobblestones.

For good food, you can undoubtedly find something in one of the many and various eateries in the area. The historic city center is a 20-30 minute walk, where there is an even greater range of food and drink, shopping, entertainment and culture.

The MAS | Museum aan de Stroom, the Red Star Line Museum and the Port House are not to be missed in the immediate vicinity, and underline the connection between the city and the water.
host_about:
I live in Antwerp, and I love being a host here! I like to offer guests a homely & comfortable place to stay, along with a smooth & worry-less Airbnb experience.

I like to travel when I get the chance. When traveling I try to use Airbnb as a guest myself as much as possible, as it's a great way to stay in extraordinary places in the snugness of a home.

name: Home in Antwerpen · ★4.43 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The old city centre is steeped in history. You will find it in ancient building-fronts on narrow streets or in the imposing Grand-Place. The Plantin-Moretus Museum is the only museum in the world to be classified as a Unesco World Heritage site. In the shadow of the Cathedral of Our Lady, the city teems with life in intimate pubs and restaurants. The banks of the Scheldt are a great place for a breath of fresh air.

Antwerp is a world city on a human scale. There’s always something to see and experience from interesting museums and fun attractions to surprising spots and architectural highlights.

"Finger-licking good food? Antwerp is the place to be! Experience the city's welcoming terraces on the many squares and, in addition to Belgian staples such as fries and chocolate, sample local delicacies such as the beer "Bolleke" and the liqueur "Elixir d'Anvers".

neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Borgerhout, affectionately known as 'Boho' by the locals ;-) This neighborhood is a vibrant, youthful, and multicultural hub, offering a unique blend of cultures and experiences.

Immerse yourself in the creative energy of Boho, where you'll discover a wealth of new, alternative, and artistic venues. Whether you're an art enthusiast, music lover, or simply seeking something out of the ordinary, Borgerhout has something to pique your interest.

Exploring the culinary scene is a delight here, with an array of cozy bars, restaurants, and bakeries just a stone's throw away. Savor diverse flavors and enjoy the warm, welcoming atmosphere that characterizes this dynamic neighborhood.

Come and experience the lively spirit of Boho for yourself, where every corner holds a new adventure and a warm welcome awaits.

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is characterized by its bustling diamond exchanges, diamond workshops, and diamond-related retail stores. Many diamond dealers and professionals from around the world visit this district to trade and purchase diamonds.

Additionally, you can find a range of restaurants, cafes, and shops in the area, catering to the needs of both the diamond trade and visitors.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★3.60 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
Condo in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Deze geweldige buurt gelegen op 15 minuten wandelafstand van het centrum van Antwerpen heet 'Het Groen Kwartier' en is heerlijk rustig, prachtig groen en geweldig qua architectuur en restaurants! Het wereldberoemde restaurant The Jane is je achterbuurvrouw!
Parkeren kan hier makkelijk op straat voor €5,- per dag, om de hoek zit het super gezellige PAKT waar je kan eten, borrelen en waar kids kunnen spelen en op 3 minuten lopen zit de supermarkt Delhaize voor al je boodschappen. Ook zeer makkelijk te bereiken met openbaar vervoer en super dichtbij het Centraal Station!

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
Rental unit in Antwerpen · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Antwerp is the nicest city in Belgium. Not only because it is such a beautiful city to see, but you can shop amazingly well, good food and certainly also in the cultural field there is a lot to discover. In the center you can enjoy yourself for days, but for the most beautiful and fun part of the city you go to Antwerp South. (10 min walk from historical center) There you will not only find the best hotspots in the culinary field, but there are also a lot of cool things to do.

Discover Antwerp South
Zuid is a beautiful neighborhood to see, with old mansions and beautiful squares. To get there it is nice to descend along the Scheldt towards the south. These quays have been completely renewed: there is a beautiful cycling and walking path and a lot of greenery has been laid out. The Kloosterstraat is also recommended for those who walk from the center to 't Zuid: you will also come across many cool (residential) shops along the way.

The charm of Antwerp South s
host_about:
Mocht je zin hebben in een goeie kop koffie (of een lokaal biertje), dan ben je van harte welkom in onze koffie bar ROAST Antwerp. We zitten in het historisch centrum (Leeuwenstraat 6), vlakbij de Vrijdagmarkt.
Onze openingstijden zijn van donderdag tot en met zaterdag van 11 - 17 uur en op koopzondagen van 12 - 17 uur. We zouden het leuk vinden om je daar te ontmoeten!

Groeten,

Linda
BnB Antwerp

neighborhood_overview: Berchem is een prachtige wijk in Antwerpen, België. Het staat bekend om zijn levendige sfeer, historische architectuur en gezellige straten. Je vindt er een mix van winkels, restaurants, cafés en parken. Het is een geweldige plek om te verkennen, te genieten van lekker eten en te ontspannen in de groene omgeving. name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Located in the second oldest street of Antwerp, this neighborhood is an oasis of calm, surrounded by green parks. You can easily walk to Middelheim Museum, which is an interesting outdoor art gallery in a park. There are a few restaurants and a small grocery store steps away from the apartment.
Yet, you are just 15 minutes away from the center thanks to excellent public transport connections and the nearby bike station (Vélo).

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★New · 3 bedrooms · 9 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

neighborhood_overview:
In the heart of Quartier National, your Airbnb stay promises a blend of history, culture, culinary delights, and convenience. Immerse yourself in the unique charm of this neighborhood, and enjoy a truly authentic Antwerp experience.

As you wander through Antwerp's winding alleys, you'll discover an array of beautifully preserved architectural gems that tell the tale of Antwerp's rich past.

Dining in Quartier National is a culinary adventure, with a diverse range of restaurants and eateries to explore. Whether you're in the mood for traditional Belgian cuisine or international flavors, you'll find something to satisfy your palate. Savor local delicacies like Belgian waffles, chocolate, and beer in charming cafés and restaurants.

Quartier National's central location makes it the perfect base for exploring Antwerp's top attractions. You're just a short walk from the Cathedral of Our Lady, the Grote Markt, and the trendy fashion district. The MoMu Fashion

name: Condo in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Je verblijft in een rustige straat met prachtige Art Déco-panden, afgewisseld met een blok grijs beton ;-) . Je vindt veel fijne bars, restaurants en kleine winkeltjes in de buurt en bent direct om de hoek van het Groen Kwartier, het verbouwde militair hospitaalterrein. Vanuit de deur maak je meteen mooie architectuurwandelingen door Berchem en in 20 minuten ben je in het stadcentrum.
Binnen 500 meter liggen twee stadsparken en je bent op loopafstand van station Berchem (10 min.) en Antwerpen Centraal (20 min.).

Een heerlijk rustige plek, buiten de toeristische zone, in een gemeleerde wijk. Ideale uitvalsbasis om Antwerpen te verkennen.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★New · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Het appartement is gelegen in een zeer rustige straat, doch in de binnenstad, waardoor het zeer makkelijk is om alles te voet te ontdekken. Ook de toegang tot openbaar vervoer: centraal station en bussen is te voet beloopbaar.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★4.67 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
In the heart of Flanders, Antwerp is a city where history and modernity intertwine, creating a neighborhood rich in culture and contemporary allure. Wander through cobblestone streets lined with medieval architecture, highlighted by the Gothic Cathedral of Our Lady, showcasing Peter Paul Rubens' masterpieces, as well as going though the lively Grote Markt, that with its ornate guild houses, offers a glimpse into the city's vibrant past.

Antwerp's status as a fashion capital is evident in its trendy Fashion District, where chic boutiques and avant-garde designers reflect the city's stylish spirit. The Royal Academy of Fine Arts further adds to this fashionable ambiance. The city's parks and the Scheldt riverbanks provide tranquil green spaces, offering a peaceful escape from urban life.

Meanwhile, the culinary and entertainment scenes in Antwerp are equally vibrant. For food enthusiasts, you can enjoy Belgian chocolates and waffles at cozy cafes, or savor modern Fl

If you planned a trip to Antwerp, let me know and I could arrange you a great stay in beautiful apartments. 

Greetings 
Arne

neighborhood_overview:
The old city centre is steeped in history. You will find it in ancient building-fronts on narrow streets or in the imposing Grand-Place. The Plantin-Moretus Museum is the only museum in the world to be classified as a Unesco World Heritage site. In the shadow of the Cathedral of Our Lady, the city teems with life in intimate pubs and restaurants. The banks of the Scheldt are a great place for a breath of fresh air.

Antwerp is a world city on a human scale. There’s always something to see and experience from interesting museums and fun attractions to surprising spots and architectural highlights.

"Finger-licking good food? Antwerp is the place to be! Experience the city's welcoming terraces on the many squares and, in addition to Belgian staples such as fries and chocolate, sample local delicacies such as the beer "Bolleke" and the liqueur "Elixir d'Anvers".

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★New · 2 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Antwerp is Belgium’s second largest city, has the biggest port and is the capital of coal. It has long been a powerful magnet for everyone from fashion moguls and club queens to art lovers and diamond dealers. In the mid-16th century it was one of Europe’s most important cities and home to baroque superstar painters like Pieter Paul Rubens. Despite many historical travails thereafter and severe WWII bombing, Antwerp retains an intriguing medieval heart with plenty of café-filled cobbled lanes, a riverside fortress and a truly impressive Cathedral. Today, however, Antwerp’s top drawcards are its vibrant fashion and entertainment scene, booming diamond businesses along with its startling architectural and cultural contrasts.

name: Rental unit in Antwerpen · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The old city centre is steeped in history. You will find it in ancient building-fronts on narrow streets or in the imposing Grand-Place. The Plantin-Moretus Museum is the only museum in the world to be classified as a Unesco World Heritage site. In the shadow of the Cathedral of Our Lady, the city teems with life in intimate pubs and restaurants. The banks of the Scheldt are a great place for a breath of fresh air.

Antwerp is a world city on a human scale. There’s always something to see and experience from interesting museums and fun attractions to surprising spots and architectural highlights.

"Finger-licking good food? Antwerp is the place to be! Experience the city's welcoming terraces on the many squares and, in addition to Belgian staples such as fries and chocolate, sample local delicacies such as the beer "Bolleke" and the liqueur "Elixir d'Anvers".
